 Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son 10ème  prêt solidaire avec l’institution, et les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés. Elles  font de la vente des habits, de condiments, du piment, etc.
Mme Mamou, assise avec l’assiette de piment et aubergine, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de 50 kg de piment frais, 1 panier de 50 kg d’aubergine, un carton de 45 unités de cube maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place  à Sikasso, auprès des grossistes et effectue ses ventes en ambulant et à domicile, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  51 250 francs CFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married for the most part in traditional families and averaging 40 years of age and five children each, the four women of the group DEMBAGNOUMA all live in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship and community and through their professional work. With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their tenth solidarity loan with the institution, and the previous loans were correctly paid back. The women sell clothing, condiments, chili peppers, etc. 

Ms. Mamou, who is sitting with a plate of chili peppers and eggplants, intends to use her loan to purchase two 50-kg sacks of fresh chili peppers, a 50-kg basket of eggplant, and a 45-count box of Maggi bouillon cubes. She gets her supplies locally in Sikasso from wholesalers, and she makes her sales to men and women customers at her house and by hawking. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit 51,250 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in the business and to meet certain household needs.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr: Les quatre  femmes du groupe Djiguissèmè sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 43ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Pelengana-sud de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de friperie et du bois de chauffe. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 14ème cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Batou   (1ère   femme debout à gauche dans la photo)  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter quelques balles de friperie  à Bamako pour pouvoir satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle. La revente se fait au comptant  à la maison et au marché à une clientèle mixe. Madame Batou   espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et élargir ses activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the Djiguissèmè Group are all married, most of them are monogamous.  The are, on average, 43 years old and have 5 children.  The women live in the Pelengana-sud neighbourhood of the town of Ségou (the fourth-largest administrative region of Mali).  They know one another through family, neighbourhood and their businesses.  They buy and sell bales of second-hand clothing and firewood.

In order to increase their business revenue, the women of the Djiguissèmè Group work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their 14th group loan.

To satisfy the needs of her customers, Batou (standing on the far left of the photo), will use her loan to buy several bales of second-hand clothing in Bamako.  She will resell them on credit from her home and at the market to a mixed customer base.  Batou expects to earn an average of 50,000 francs CFA a month.  She will use her earnings to provide for the needs of her children and increase the size of her business.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    BALIMAYA est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  DIALANIKORO de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 10éme prêt. Les 9 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de MAH qui est la 2éme femme   dans la photos de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, diverses sortes de condiments  avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Balimaya Group is made up of 4 women, who are all married, with an average age of 45 years, and 6 children.  They live in traditional, extended families in the Dialanikoro area of the town of Bougouni.  They know one another through friendship, neighbourhood and business ties.

The women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, to improve their financial situation and be more efficient in their businesses.  This will be their tenth loan, the previous 9 loans have all been fully repaid.

The Balimaya Group buy and sell ingredients, spices and seasonings.  Mah is part of the group, and is standing second on the right.  She will use her loan to buy various ingredients, spices and seasonings from wholesalers in Bougouni.  She resells her products from home and at the market, for cash and credit, to customers who are usually women.  She expects to earn a monthly average of 32,000 francs CFA, and will use her earnings to reinvest in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, spices and seasonings.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    SABALI est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  FARABA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 5éme prêt. Les 4 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de AWA qui est la femme  debout au milieu dans la photos. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  diverses quantités de condiments avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Sabali group is made up of 6 married women who are on average 38 years old with 5 children each. They live in traditional extended families in the Faraba neighborhood of the city of Bougouni. The women came to know each other as neighbors, friends, and through their businesses. In order to increase their financial capacity to be better able to conduct their businesses, they partnered with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their 5th group loan. Their previous 4 loans have been fully repaid.

Awa, pictured as the woman standing in the middle of the photo, is in the business of selling spices. She plans to use her loan to purchase various quantities of spices from wholesalers in Bougouni. She makes her sales at the market and from her home, at retail for cash and for credit, to a customer base made up mostly of women. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr: Les huit femmes du groupe Sabali sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 31ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Hamdallaye de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de condiments, de  friperie, de graine d’arachide et de produits alimentaires. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Assitan  (1ère   femme debout à droite dans la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une très grande quantité d’oignon à Niono pour pouvoir satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle. La revente se fait au comptant  à la maison et au marché à une clientèle mixe. Madame Assitan  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et élargir ses activités.
texts.en:
The eight women of the Sabali group are mostly married and living in monogamous households. They are on average 31 years old with 2 children each, and all live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of the city of Ségou in the fourth administrative region of Mali. The women came to know each other through relatives and as neighbors, and through their various businesses in the neighborhood. 

The women are in the business of spices, used clothing, peanut seeds, and various food products. With the goal of increasing their business funds, the members of the group decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan.

Assitan, the first woman pictured standing from right to left in the photo, plans to use her loan to purchase a bulk quantity of onions in Niono to be able to satisfy the needs of her customers. She makes her sales from her home and at the market to a customer base made up of both men and women. Assitan hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA with this loan, which she will use to care for the needs of her children and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr: Les cinq femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Pelengana-Sud e la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de friperies, de jus, de pagnes bazins et d’articles divers. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème   cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Maria (2ème  femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter deux balles de friperie  chez son fournisseur à Bamako pour pouvoir satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle. La revente se fait au comptant  à la maison et au marché à une clientèle mixe. Madame Maria espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et élargir ses activités.
texts.en:
The five women of the Tiessiri Group are all married, most of them are monogamous.  They are, on average, 39 years old and have 5 children.  The women all live in the Pelengana-Sud area of the town of Ségou (the fourth-largest, administrative region of Mali).  They know one another through family, neighbourhood and their businessses.  The women buy and sell bales of second-hand clothing, juice, damask pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing) and various other articles.

This will be the second group loan for these women, who work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to improve the financial situation of their businesses.  

Maria, standing second from the right in the photo, will use her loan to buy two bales of second-hand clothing from her supplier in Bamako.  In this way, she will be able to better satisfy the needs of her customers.  She resells the clothing on credit from home, and at the market, to a mixture of clients.  Maria expects to earn a monthly average of 30,000 francs CFA, which will be used to provide for the needs of her children and increase the size of her business.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Né en  Mars 1977 à Sikasso, Monsieur  Yacouba est marié et père de six enfants, il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle Bougoula Hameau,village situé à environ 7 km de la ville de Sikasso.
Monsieur Yacouba  après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié au commerce dont il dispose une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où il mène cette activité d’achat et vente des articles divers (maïs, Cigarette, bonbon, allumette, Chewing-gum, lait en poudre, thé, sucre, savon,) depuis plus de douze ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il ya environ cinq ans. Ainsi il bénéficié six prêts individuels qui ont été tous correctement remboursés. Alors, il sollicite ce septième prêt lui permettant d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acquérir 3 tonnes de maïs, 25 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 10 carton du thé, 15 sacs du sucre, 10 paquets de lait en poudre, 12 paquets de bonbon, 15 paquet de Chewing-gum, 35 paquets d’allumette et 15 cartons de savon.
S’approvisionnant auprès de commerçants grossistes de la ville de Sikasso et environnants, il revend ses marchandises en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de toutes sortes de couches sociales de sa localité.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in March 1977 in Sikasso, Mr. Yacouba is married and has six children. He lives with his wife and children in an extended traditional family in Bougoula, a village located 7 km [4 km] from the town of Sikasso.

Having tried various business activities without success, Yacouba started a retail business. He sets up shop before his family home. He has been buying and selling miscellaneous products (corn, cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, soap etc) for over 12 years. He has many customers because of the high quality of his products.

In order to meet his ever growing demand, about five years ago he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. He already obtained six individuals loan, all of which have been duly repaid. Thus he is requesting his 7th loan, allowing him to increase his working capital to buy three tons [6,614 lbs] of corn, 25 cartons of various cigarettes, 10 cartons of tea, 15 bags of sugar, 10 packs of powdered milk, 12 packs of candy, 15 packs of chewing gum, 35 gums of matches and 15 boxes of soap. He stocks up from wholesalers in the town of Sikasso and nearby. He resells in retail, for cash and on credit, to customers coming from all social strata in his neighborhood. With this loan, he plans to earn a monthly revenue of 100,000 West African francs, which will be used to contribute to the household needs, pay off the interest on his loan and reinvest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr: Les huit femmes du groupe Yiriwa sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Hamdallaye de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de pagnes, de condiments, de farine de blé et du bois de chauffe. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Nene (1èrefemme debout à gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de farine de toute sorte dans le quartier de Hamdallaye. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter deux sacs de farine  chez son fournisseur à pour pouvoir satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle. La revente se fait au comptant  à la maison et au marché à une clientèle mixe. Madame Nene espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et élargir ses activités.
texts.en:
The eight women of the Yiriwa group are mostly married and living in monogamous households. They are on average 30 years old with 2 children each, and all live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of the city of Ségou in the fourth administrative region of Mali. They came to know each other through neighbors and relatives and through their businesses in the neighborhood.

The women are in the business of selling "pagne" cloth, spices, wheat flour, and firewood. In order to increase their business funds, the members of the group decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan.

Nene, pictured as the first woman standing on the left on the photo, is a successful seller of all kinds of flour in the Hamdallaye neighborhood. She plans to use her loan to purchase two bags of flour from her supplier in order to meet the needs of her customers. She makes her sales for cash from her home and at the market to a customer base made up of both men and women. Nene hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA with this loan, which she will use to provide for the needs of her children and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DANAYA est constitué de 5 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 9éme prêt. Les 8 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  tasses.
à l’image de MAIMOUNA qui est la 1ére femme débout  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 4 douzaines de  tasses.avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of 5 married women who are on average 30 years old with 3 children each. They live in traditional extended families in the Massablacoura neighborhood of the city of Bougouni. The women came to know each other as neighbors, friends, and through their businesses.

In order to increase their financial capacity in order to better run their businesses, the women have partnered with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their 9th group loan with the organization; their previous 8 loans have all been fully repaid.

Maimouna, the woman pictured standing first on the right in the photo, is in the business of selling cups. She plans to use her loan to purchase 4 dozen cups from wholesalers in Bamako. She makes her sales at the market and from her home, at retail for both cash and credit, to a customer base made up mostly of women. Maimouna hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA which she will use to reinvest in her business and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase cups

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DEMBAGNOUMA est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de42 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3éme prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  cosmétiques à l’image de HABI qui est la femme avec l’enfant   dans la photo. Elle fait l’achat vente de  cosmétiques et compte acheter avec son  prêt, diverses quantités de matière première avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Dembagnouma group is made up of 6 women, all married, with an average age of 42 years and an average of 6 children each. They live in traditional larger families in the Torakabougou neighborhood in the city of Bougouni. The women came to know each other through relatives, friends, and their businesses.

In order to increase their financial capacity in order to better conduct their businesses, the women partnered with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan. Their previous two loans have been fully repaid. 

Habi, the woman pictured with the child in the photo, is in the cosmetics business. She purchases and resells cosmetics and plans to use her loan to purchase different quantities of raw materials from wholesalers in Bamako. She makes her sales at the market and from her home, at retail for cash and credit to a customer base made up mostly of women. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA which she will use to reinvest in her business and pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    LAIDOU est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4éme prêt. Les 3 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles de boutique à l’image de MAIMOUNA qui est la 1ére femme   dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, divers articles de boutique avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group LAIDOU comprises four married women, who average 35 years of age and four children each. The women lives in traditional extended families in the MASSABLACOURA district of Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity in order to run their businesses better, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth loan. The previous three were correctly paid back.

This group of women does commerce in shop goods, as is the case with MAIMOUNA, who is the first women at the right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase a variety of shop goods from Bamako wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales retail to a customer base composed essentially of women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her work and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase various shop goods to sell

loans.name: Hamidou

texts.fr:
Agé de 51 ans environ, HAMIDOU a une épouse et père de 5 enfants. Il vit  avec sa famille dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso).  
Dû à des raisons sociales, il n’a pas eu la chance d’être instruit  raison pour laquelle il s’est basé sur les  activités  génératrices de revenus  depuis à bas âge notamment l’achat, stockage et vente de céréales. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenus, sa demande est souvent très grande par rapport à l’offre car il reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, Monsieur HAMIDOU a fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso  depuis plus 7 ans. Il est à son 8ème prêt en individuel et les 7 précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté. Ce prêt sera  utilisé pour l’acquisition d’un stock de céréales. Il s’approvisionne à Koutiala et environnant, effectue sa vente à Bamako et Koutiala, en gros et en détail. 
Avec le renforcement de son fonds de roulement, il compte réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel de 100.000 FCFA  qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement de son prêt, satisfaire les besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Hamidou is roughly 51 years old, with a wife and 5 children. He lives with his family in the city of Koutiala (Sikasso Region). 

Due to social circumstances, he did not have the opportunity to get an education, which is why he began supporting himself through various income-generating activities at a young age, particularly purchasing, storing and selling grains. This business provides him with enough income, and demand is often much larger than his supply, because he receives a large number of customers every day. 

Hamidou has been working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for more than 7 years in order to be able to satisfy his customers and expand his business. This is his 8th individual loan, after having repaid the previous 7 loans without any issues. This loan will be used to stock up on grains. He gets his supplies in Koutiala and the surrounding areas, and sells his products wholesale and retail in Bamako and Koutiala. 

With this boost to his working capital, Hamidou plans on earning a monthly income of 100,000 CFA Francs, which he will use to pay back his loan, support his family and invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Gnessouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe   GNESSOUMA   sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogamiques à Hamdallaye un des quartiers populaire de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme FATOUMATA fait le commerce  des pagnes wax dans ce groupe de femmes   GNESSOUMA elle se tient en deuxième position de la  gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environs 10 pièces de pagnes qu’elle revend en détail sur place en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 36 000 francs cfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Gnessouma group are married women with an average age of 36 years and who have an average of 4 children each. They live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods of Sikasso in the third administrative region of Mali. They are on their fifth loan with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet the needs of their customers.

Fatoumata is in the business of selling wax "pagne" cloth (the traditional colorful cloth of western Africa). She is pictured as the second from the left to right in the photo. Fatoumata plans to use her loan to purchase about 10 pieces of "pagne" cloth which she will resell locally at retail for cash to a customer base made up mostly of women. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 36,000 francs CFA, a portion of which she will use to pay back the loan and the interest, and the rest of which will go to savings.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Agé de 37 ans, Oumar  est marié, père de 3 enfants et domicilié  à Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Mr Oumar dispose d’une quincaillerie. Il trouve que son  activité est beaucoup rentable, sa demande est souvent très grande. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité,  Monsieur Oumar a fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs.  Il est à son  1er prêt   individuel. Ce prêt sera  utilisé pour l’acquisition d’un stock de diverses marchandises : matériels électriques et de construction. Il s’approvisionne auprès  des grossistes de Koutiala et de Bamako et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique à Koutiala à une clientèle mixte en espèce. Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, Monsieur Oumar compte réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel de 80.000 FCFA, qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement de son prêt, satisfaire à ses besoins et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Aged 37, Oumar is married, a father of three children and a resident of Koutiala (Sikasso region). Oumar runs a hardware shop. He finds that this business profitable and demand is often very high. 

In order to satisfy his customers and to expand his business, Oumar has joined with the micro-finance institution Soro Yirwaso. He is on his first individual loan. 

This loan will be used to buy stock of various goods, [including] electrical goods and construction materials. He procures this stock from the wholesalers in Koutiala and Bamako and makes his sales for cash in his shop in Koutiala to a mixed clientele.

By expanding his business, Oumar hopes to earn an average monthly income of 80,000 francs CFA, which he will use to pay back his loan, support his needs, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe DJANTOYERELA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames au quartier Noumousso de Kadiolo. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme   SITAN  fait le commerce de  condiments dans ce groupe de femmes, elle  est assise au milieu sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  2 paniers de 50 kg de soumbala 3 et revend en détail  en Côte d’Ivoire à une clientèle composée de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 52 500 francs cfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the DJANTOYERELA group are married women averaging 40 years old with 5 children each. Most of them live in polygamous families in the Noumousso neighborhood of Kadiolo. 

This is their eleventh loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, in the hopes of satisfying their customers.

Sitan, seated in the middle of the photo, is the group member who sells condiments. With her loan, she intends to buy two 50 kg baskets of soumbala [a West African condiment], which she will sell for cash to female retail customers in Côte d’Ivoire. 

She plans on earning an average monthly income of 52,500 CFA Francs, part of which will be used to pay off her loan with interest, and the rest of which will go into her savings.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr: Agé de 25 ans, Oumar est célibataire sans enfants. Il vit avec ses parents  dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). Oumar n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études, raison pour laquelle il s’est basé sur les activités génératrices de revenus depuis plus de 5 ans. Il est très bien sollicité par ses clients. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle, Mr Oumar a fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, il est a son 1er prêt.  Avec ce financement  il compte acheter 5 téléphones portables et des pièces de rechange à Bamako, il effectue sa vente dans son kiosque à Koutiala, à une clientèle mixte en espèce. Avec ce financement, il compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qu’il utilisera pour subvenir à ses besoins et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Aged 25, Oumar is single and has no children. He lives with his parents in the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region). Oumar has not had the chance to study,  which is why he has been working to earn money for more than five years now. He is highly sought after by his customers.

To satisfy his customers, Oumar has joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his first loan.

With this financing, he plans to buy five mobile phones and some spare parts in Bamako. He makes his sales from his kiosk in Koutiala, to a mixed clientele for cash.

With this loan, Oumar hopes to earn an average monthly income of 90,000 francs CFA, which he will use to support his needs and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Brehima

texts.fr:
Mr Brehima est âgé de 41 ans, 6 enfants, marié et vit dans une famille polygame dans la ville de Koutiala  avec sa famille. 
Mr Brehima a prématurément abandonné l’école pour s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis son enfance auprès de ses frères. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite,  s’est finalement basé sur  l’achat-vente de poissons fumés il y a 13 ans.  Pour  pouvoir augmenter son fonds de commerce et renforcer sa capacité de vente, il décida de rejoindre  l‘institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 4 ans. Il est à son 7ème prêt  individuel et les précédents ont été bien remboursés. Il compte acheter 15 paniers de poissons fumés  à Korientzé  (Région de Mopti) auprès des  pêcheurs d’ethnie  Bozo et Somonô et effectue sa vente au marché poisson à une clientèle mixte au comptant ou à crédit. 
Avec ce financement il compte  réaliser un profit de 120.000FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera pour  le remboursement des intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire les besoins  de sa  famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Brehima is 41 years old, is married, has six children, and lives with a polygamous family in the town of Koutiala with his family. Brehima stopped school early in order to work like his brothers. After having pursued several business activities without success, Brehima finally went into the buying and selling of smoked fish, [which he has been doing] for 13 years.

In order to increase his business capital and to expand his selling capacity, Brehima decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. This is his seventh individual loan, and his previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

He plans to buy 15 baskets of smoked fish in Korientze (Mopti region) from the Bozo and Somono fishers. He will make his sales at a fish market to a mixed clientele for cash or credit.

With this loan, he hopes to earn 120,000 francs CFA each month, which he will use to pay back his loan to Soro Yiriwaso, support the needs of his family, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish

loans.name: Badengnajourou Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe  BADENGNAJOUROU sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygames au quartier  BABEMBA  de la ville de  Sikasso, 3ème  la région de région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec  Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  Rokia  fait le commerce de  chaussures dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient à l’extrême droite sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 50 paires de chaussure en plastique par moi et revend en détail  sur place et au marché à une clientèle composée de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22 500 francs cfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the BADENGNAJOUROU group are married women who average 31 years old with 5 children each. They live in polygamous families in the Babemba neighborhood of the city of Sikasso, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

This is their eleventh loan with Soro Yiriwaso, in the hopes of satisfying their customers.

Rokia is the group member who sells shoes. She is on the far right in the photo. 

With the loan, she plans on purchasing 50 pairs of plastic shoes per month that she will sell to female retail customers locally and at the market for cash. 

She plans earning an average monthly income of 22,500 CFA Francs, part of which will be used to pay back her loan with interest, and the rest of which will go into her savings.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.fr:
Mr Sidi est âgée de 43 ans, marié à deux femmes, père de 5 enfants et habite dans la ville de Koutiala  avec sa famille. 
Mr Sidi n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études, ainsi il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis son enfance. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, il s’est basé sur  la vente des poissons fumés. Sa notoriété est bonne, car les poissons fumés sont les plus prisés à Koutiala.  Pour pouvoir  augmenter son fonds de commerce et renforcer sa capacité de vente, il a décidé de rejoindre  l‘institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui il est à son 1er prêt. Il s’approvisionne à Korientzé  (Région de Mopti) auprès des  pêcheurs et effectue sa vente au  marché poisson de Koutiala  à une clientèle  mixte  au comptant et à crédit.
Avec ce financement il compte  réaliser un profit de 50 000FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement de son prêt, satisfaire les besoins  de sa  famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Sidi is 43 years old, is married to two wives, has five children, and lives in the Koutiala with this family. Sidi did not have the chance to go to school, and he became interested in working for a living in his childhood.

After having pursued several business activities without success, he finally settled on the selling of smoked fish. His reputation is well-known, because his smoked fish are the most popular in Koutiala.

In order to increase his business funds and selling capacity, Sidi decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is his first loan.

He procures the fish from Korientze (Mopti region) from the fishers there and makes his sales in a fish market in Koutiala to a mixed clientele for cash and credit. 

With this loan, he hopes to earn a profit of 50,000 francs CFA per month, which he will use to pay back his loan, support the needs of his family, and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Né vers 1956 à KADIANA commune de KADIANA, Souleymane y  réside  avec ses 3 enfants et sa femme, dans une famille traditionnelle.
Mr SOULEYMANE s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales.  Il est très sollicité à Kadiana et surtout le jour de foire. 
Fort de ses 5 années d’expériences dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  premier prêt, SOULEYMANE compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des céréales. Il s’approvisionne chez les producteurs  dans les villages avoisinants. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché essentiellement à  des hommes.
SOULEYMANE espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 140.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1956 in Kadiana, in the Kadiana commune, Souleymane lives there with his three children and his wife in a traditional family. Souleymane quickly became interested in income-generating activities, especially the buying and selling of cereals. He is highly sought after in Kadiana, especially on market days.

With over five years experience in this area, he is working with Soro Yiriwaso to increase his business funds and satisfy his customers, who are continuing to increase in number. This is his first loan.

Souleymane plans to use his loan to buy cereals, which he procures from producers in surrounding villages. He makes his sales for cash and sometimes for credit mostly in the market to male customers.

Souleymane hopes to earn an average monthly income of 140,000 francs CFA, which he will use to support the needs of his family, repay his loan, and  reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKOLA ont en moyenne  38 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  DALLAN dans la ville  de SAN de la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente produits alimentaires.
 Apres avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents,  les femmes du groupe BENKOLA sont à leur 3 eme  prêt solidaire. ASSAN 1 ère femme à gauche rose sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, deux balles composées de pagnes wax et de chapeaux pour  enfants. Elle s’approvisionne à  BAMAKO et  effectue ses ventes, sur place à SAN et les foires des villages environnants, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes très généralement en espèce.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Benkola group average 38 years old with five children each. They all live in extended traditional families in Dallan, in the town of San, which lies in the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

These women met each other through relatives and buy and sell groceries.

Having repaid their previous loans in full, the women of the Benkola group are now are on their third group loan. Assan, who is standing on the far left of the photo in pink, is planning to use her loan to buy two bales of "pagnes wax" (highly decorative and colorful pieces of fabric) and children's hats. She gets her supplies in Bamako and sells them locally in San and at fairgrounds in the surrounding villages, to a customer base made up of women and men, generally for cash.

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 25,000FCFA, which will be used for health, food, clothing and education costs, with the remainder being reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Ambenkoun Group

texts.fr: Les six femmes du groupe Ambenkoun sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 29 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Pelengana-Nord dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de savon, de spaghetti et des produits cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle du prêt solidaire.Madame Fatoumata (1èrefemme assise  à droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de savon de toute sorte dans le quartier de Pelengana-Nord. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des cartons de savon à Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant  à la maison et au marché à une clientèle mixe. Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et élargir ses activités.
texts.en:
The six women in Ambenkoun Group are married, and most of them live in monogamous households. They average 29 years of age and two children. They all live in Pelengana-Nord, a neighborhood in Ségou Region (fourth administrative region of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of community, kinship, and trough the money-earning businesses they run in the neighborhood. They retail soaps, spaghettis, and cosmetics.

In order to bolster their working capital, the members of the group decided to work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their first solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Fatoumata is the woman sitting on the right in the photograph. She's a big seller of all kinds of soaps in Pelengana-Nord. She intends to use her loan to buy boxes of soaps in Ségou.

She resells for cash at her home and at the market, to a mixed clientele. With this loan, she hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 20'000, to be used to cover her children's needs and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soap

loans.name: Santiago De Lacaya - 26 Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento SANTIAGO DE LACAYA – 26  está compuesta por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón  todos ellos se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Jhenny tiene 23años casada con un hijito de la edad de dos añitos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de bisutería, variedad de productos para mujeres, ella tiene su puesto de venta en una de las calles más concurridas  de la ciudad de la Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Jhenny va a usar este préstamo para compra bisutería por mayor y variedad de productos para surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Jhenny enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir surtiendo su mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: The venture bank group SANTIAGO DE LACAYA - 26 is composed for eight members (seven women, one man) all of whom are engaged in different activities. The bank president is Jhenny, 23. She is married and has a two-year-old son. She sells jewelry and a variety of women's products. She has a stall on one of the busiest streets in the city of La Paz. This is her first loan sequence within the institution. Jhenny is going to use this loan to buy jewelry wholesale and a variety of products to stock her business. Her reason for applying for this loan is to increase her products. Jhenny faces challenges in her business, mainly competition. She will use the profits to continue stocking her merchandise so she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for her family in this way.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale jewelry.

loans.name: Ankadignonye Group

texts.fr: Les six femmes du groupe Ankadignonye sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sando-Sido dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de condiments, du lait, d’arachide et du mil. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle du prêt solidaire.Madame Nènè (1èrefemme assise  à droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments de toute sorte dans le le village  de Sando-Sido. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une très grande quantité de condiment  à Ségou  pour  la satisfaction du besoin de sa clientèle. La revente se fait au comptant  à la maison et au marché à une clientèle mixe. Madame Nènè espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et élargir ses activités.
texts.en:
The six women in Ankadignonye Group are married, and most of them live in monogamous households. They average 37 years of age and four children. They all live in Sando-Sido, a neighborhood in Ségou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of community, kinship, and through the money-earning businesses they run in the village. They retail condiments, milk, peanuts, and millet.

In order to bolster their working capital, the members of the group decided to work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their first solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Nènè is the woman sitting on the right in the photograph. She's a big seller of all sorts of condiments in Sando-Sido. She intends to use her loan to buy a large quantity of condiments in Ségou, in order to satisfy the needs of her clientele.

She resells for cash at her home and at the market, to a mixed clientele. With this loan, she hopes to tun an average monthly profit of XOF 25'000 (ca US$ 50), to be used to provide for her children's needs and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Suu's Group

texts.en:
Suu was born in 1973. She lives with her family in Dong Anh, Hanoi. She has three children. Her oldest child is studying at the university, her youngest child is in primary school and her middle child is in high school. Her husband is a driver. She sells beef to earn a living. She earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for years. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is the lack of capital to sell beef. Her dream is to grow her business and buy more equipment for her house. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach this dream. Suu is a hard working woman. She also has a passion for her job. This is the first time she has participated in SEDA's credit program. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to sell pork. She always wanted to expand her business and have a better life in future.

Other members who are part of Suu’s group include the following:
Hoai was born in 1977. She has two children. She sells beef to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy materials to sew.
Che was born in 1967. She has a child. She sells food to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to sell food.
Hop was born in 1975. She has three children. She sells pork to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to sell pork.
Thuy was born in 1988. She sells drinks to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to sell drinks.
Chinh was born in 1968. She has two children. She sells vegetables to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to sell vegetables.

loans.use: to sell pork.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San was born in 1963. She lives with her family in Dong Anh, Hanoi. She has three children. Two of them have got married, the other is unemployed. Her husband is a cattle raiser. 

San sells porks to earn a living. She earns about 4,000,000 to 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for over 10 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is the lack of capital to maintain her business. Her dream is to grow her business and buy more equipment for her house. This loan is one of steps to help her reaching to this dream. San is a hard working woman. She also has a passion for her job. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2006. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 10,682,000 VND to maintain her pork selling business. She has always wanted to expand her business and have a better life in future.

Other members who are part of San's group include the following:

Lan is 36 years old. She has three children. She sews clothing to earn a living. She wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy materials to sew.

Hoa is 53 years old. She has two children. She sells food to earn a living. She wants to borrow 10,682,000 VND to sell food.

Hoa is 29 years old. She has two children. She sells groceries to earn a living. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to sell groceries.

Thoa is 31 years old. She has two children. She sews clothing to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy materials to sew.

Lan is 47 years old. She has two children. She is a cement retailer. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to sell cement.

loans.use: to maintain her pork selling business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de 54 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo, hermano y dos nietos. Desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales, quesadillas y antojitos típicos. De este negocio logra llevar el sustento diario a su familia la cual es lo más preciado para ella. Su principal patrimonio es su casa que con mucho esfuerzo junto a su esposo han logrado construir. Desea terminar de poner las puertas de los dormitorios ya que por la falta de capital no han logrado comprar. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de 4 puertas de madera y dos ventanas para asegurar los dormitorios de su vivienda y dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Margarita, 54, lives in the house she owns with her husband, brother, and two grandchildren. For a long time, she has made her living making and selling tamales, quesadillas, and typical snacks. This business does provide daily sustenance to her family, which is most precious to her. Her main asset is her home  that she and her husband have built with hard work. She wants to finish putting doors on the bedroom which they have not been able to buy due to lack of capital. She has applied for this credit with FUSAI to invest in the purchase of four wooden doors and two windows to ensure that bedrooms in her home provide greater security for her family.

loans.use: to purchase 4 wooden doors and 2 windows to provide more security to the bedrooms in her house.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past two years, Josephine has operated a clothes selling business, selling bedsheets and curtains. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more bales of bedsheets and curtains to resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of bedsheets and curtains to resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy animals for butchering.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is from Gyumri town where he lives with his wife and mother.  Hamlet has been giving football training to local children at a local sports school for the past five years. Hamlet is very skilled and professional in his job, so he has currently 54 students in the group who come to him to learn how to play football. Hamlet is the only breadwinner of the family, as his mother is retired and his wife takes care of household only. 

By applying for this loan Hamlet asks for financial support to be able to purchase a sporting ground needed for his job. This will give him an opportunity to improve the quality of training he provides and make his training more time efficient. Hamlet has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This hard working and enthusiastic man, Hamlet, will be very thankful for the loan as it is very important to him.

loans.use: to pay for a sporting ground to provide football training to local children.

loans.name: Elda

texts.es: Elda, de 41 años de edad, está separada y es madre de 03 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Elda se dedica a la venta de frutas. En las mañanas labora  como ayudante en un restaurant que es de propiedad de su amiga lo cual le genera un ingreso económico. En las tardes se dedica a la venta de frutas en un mercado cercano, está  actividad lo empezó a realizar  comprando en pocas cantidades de frutas  con su propio capital, y viendo la buena acogida que tuvo su negocio se decidió continuar y hasta el momento se dedica  sola. Antes de tener esta actividad sus ingresos económicos eran muy pocos y no le alcanzaban para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar, ya que se había separado del padre de sus hijos. Teniendo esta dificultad se decidió a empezar este negocio. Viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de continuar y aumentar su negocio ya que se hizo conocido por la zona y espera comprar variedades de  frutas, así poder tener más acogida, así  verá crecer su negocio. Este será su préstamo número 07 con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, comprará frutas al por mayor, para surtir su negocio y ofrecer mayor  variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Elda, 41, is separated and the mother of 3 children with whom she lives in her own home. Elda sells fruit. In the mornings, she works as an assistant in a restaurant that is owned by her friend which generates an income. In the afternoons, she sells fruit in a nearby market. She began this activity by making purchases of fruit in small quantities with her own capital. Seeing the good reception given to this business, she decided to continue and dedicate herself to this activity alone. Prior to starting this activity, her income was little and she did not have enough to cover all household expenses, as she had separated from the father of her children. Given this difficulty, she decided to start this business. Seeing the good results, she plans to continue and increase her business as it has become well-known in the area. She hopes to buy a variety of fruits to have a better reception in the market and grow her business in this way. This will be her 7th loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she has received to move forward. She agrees to pay her dues on time. With the amount requested of 1,200 nuevos soles, she will buy fruit wholesale to stock her business and offer more variety to customers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale fruits.

loans.name: Dinh's Group

texts.en:
Dinh was born in 1966. She is now living with her family in Bac Ninh. She has a son who is learning at a primary school. She sews clothing to earn a living. She earns about 4,000,000 VND per month and that’s also her family’s total earnings. She has done this job for 12 years. Her challenge in life and work is the lack of capital to sew clothing and she works very hard because she has a broken leg. Her dreams are to expand her business and for her son to be successful in life. This loan is one of the steps to help her get to this dream. Dinh is a hard working and dynamic woman. She also has a passion for her job. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 5,125,000 VND and repaid on time. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 6,048,000 VND to buy materials to sew clothing. She always wants to buy more sewing machines and save profits for her son’s education.

Other members who are part of Dinh's group include the following:

Vu was born in 1967. She has two children. She raises chickens to earn a living. She wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND to raise chicken.
Thu was born in 1964. She has three children. She is a driller. She wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to raise pigs.
Hong was born in 1978. She has three children. She sells fruit to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy fruit to sell.
Hop was born in 1971. She has three children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to raise pigs.

loans.use: to buy materials to sew clothing.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia es una persona honesta, responsable y muy trabajadora, vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una localidad  al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 10 años.
Doña Cecilia vende en su comunidad y a las personas que trabajan en las cañeras y meloneras cercanas a esta. Está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como ser: maíz, cal, leña, etc. el cual necesita para la elaboración de su producto. 
Doña Cecilia espera que con el préstamo logre comprar los insumos necesarios para poder elaborar su producto y de igual manera aumentar las ventas y gracias a esto ganar más ingresos  que beneficien su estilo de vida y el de su familia.
Doña Cecilia espera hacer que sus negocio crezca y sea el más conocido de la zona  y así poder ayudar a sus hijos para que continúen los estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre 2013
texts.en:
Cecilia is an honest, responsible, and hardworking person. She lives with her husband and their two children in a village in the south of Honduras. Her business is making and selling tortillas, which she has done for 10 years.
Doña Cecilia sells in her community and to the people who work in the nearby sugar cane and melon fields. She is applying for a loan for the purchase of raw materials such as corn, lime, firewood, and others that she needs to make her product. Doña Cecilia expects to buy the necessary supplies to make her product and increase sales with this loan. Thanks to this loan, she expects to gain more revenue to benefit her family and their quality of life.
Doña Cecilia hopes to make her business grow and be the best known in the area so that she can help her children continue their studies and become good people with greater opportunities in their lives.





Choluteca, Honduras - October 2013

loans.use: to purchase corn, lime, firewood, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa was born in 1976. She is now living with her family in Bac Ninh. She has two sons who are studying at a secondary school and a university. Her husband is a carpenter and so is she. She also works as a farmer to earn a living. She earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for eight years. Her family’s total earnings are about 15,000,000 per month. Her challenge in life and work is the lack of capital to buy wood for crusting. Her dream is to expand her business. This loan is one step to help her get to this dream. Hoa is a hard working and dynamic woman. She also has a passion for her job. She said that this job help her earn more money to pay for living expenses and have more time to take care of her family. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 10,080,000 VND and repaid on time. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 10,976,000 VND to buy wood for carpentry work. She always wants to expand her business, improve her family’s life and save profits for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy wood for carpentry work.

loans.name: Lourdes Esperanza

texts.es:
Lourdes, necesita invertir en el negocio de tortillas que posee, ella comprará maíz, leña, bolsas y papel. Con el préstamo anterior ella tuvo todo lo necesario para su negocio, pudo atender a sus clientes como ellos merecen, su producción hoy es más que antes, ha ganado más clientela, su economía es más, algunas veces tiene su temporada de pocas ventas pero se mantiene responsable cancelando sus cuotas.
Su familia vive en mejores condiciones, todos están saludables y la apoyan para que siga adelante con el negocio.
texts.en:
Lourdes needs to invest in the tortilla business she has. She will buy corn, firewood, bags and paper. With the previous loan she had everything she needed for her business and she was able to attend to her customers as they deserve. Today her production is greater than it was before; she has gained more customers and has more of a budget. Sometimes she has periods of low sales, but she keeps herself responsible, making her payments.
Her family lives in better conditions, and everyone is healthy and supports her so that she may get ahead with the business.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, bags and paper

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, palm nut, cassava, etc. to sell

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a 31-year-old housewife from a small village of Dhupguri. In her family, she has her husband and three children. Saira passed class VI (grade 6), and her husband studied until class IX (grade 9). They also send two children to school; the other is too small to go to school. Both of them are very ambitious and want to give a good life to their children with a good education.

Saira’s husband is engaged in the agriculture business. They have their own land where her husband grows different vegetables and crops in different seasons, and supplies those items to the wholesale market. Now she plans to take a loan to invest in potato growing by buying necessary supplies like potato seeds, fertilizers, urea and more. Saira decided to plant potatoes because potatoes are a year-round crop and a very popular vegetable in India. Potatoes are used in most Indian dishes. 

In the future, she dreams to extend her business by buying more land with the profit earned from the business. Saira is very much grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds, fertilizers and urea for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Khiromani

texts.en:
Khiromani is a 45-year-old hardworking homemaker who lives with her husband. They have one child. Both Khiromani and her husband are illiterate and just know to sign their names. Her husband is a rickshaw puller, but his income is not sufficient to bear all the expenses of the family. They are so poor that they cannot even send their child to school. Their child is also involved in the shuttering business. They stay in a kaccha house (house made of mud, bamboo, straw, etc.).

Khiromani is a hardworking woman; she wants to start a shuttering (the temporary wooden framework for construction of a building) business to give support to her family financially. She wants to take this loan to purchase tools for the shuttering business.  She has decided to start this business, as her son is experienced in this field, and it is also a profitable and in-demand business in that locality. 

Her future dream is to develop this trade on a large scale so that they can have as much profit as they can, and with that they can fulfill all their dreams. She is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan, as she was very much in need of it.

loans.use: to purchase tools to start a shuttering business.

loans.name: Vu

texts.en:
Vu was born in 1969 and lives with her family in Bac Ninh. She has a son and a daughter who attend secondary school. Her husband is a carpenter and she is a farmer. Vu has been helping her husband in his carpentry work for 10 years. She earns about 6,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. A work-related challenge is the lack of capital to buy wood for crusting. 

Her dream is to expand her business and have her children be successful. This loan is one of the steps needed to help her reach this dream. Vu is a hard working woman who is passionate about her job. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 10,080,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 10,976,000 VND to buy a machine for carpentry work. She has always wanted to have a wood shop, improve her family’s standard of living and save for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a machine for carpentry work.

loans.name: Jessika Wendy

texts.es: La Señorita Jessika tiene 24 años y es Soltera,  estudia la carrera  Técnico Superior,   trabaja para pagar sus estudios,  su madre le ayuda, ella tiene una tienda de barrio en su mismo domicilio con el que se hacen cargo del repago del crédito,  la Señorita Jessika estudia en la institución educativa   muy reconocida de la Ciudad de La Paz este es su primer crédito con la institucion y  va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar cómo Financiar los Gastos escolares de matriculación, Materiales y/o útiles para terminar sus estudios que durara el tiempo 3 Años,  la Señorita Jessika enfrenta retos en su estudios que son el tener que estudiar y trabajar ya que existe mucha deserción en las universidades  porque no pueden pagar sus gastos de titulación, escolaridad etc. vive en la zona  Zona Villa La Merced su deseo cuando termine sus estudios es Quiere terminar su profesión, mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Miss Jessika, 24, is single and studying for a technical career. She works to pay for her studies. Her mother also helps her. She has a neighborhood store in her own house in which she will earn the money to repay her loan. Jessika studies in a highly regarded educational institution in the city of La Paz. This is her first loan with the institution. She will use this loan for different expenses that she incurs due to her studies such as enrollment costs and materials that are useful to finish her studies which will take 3 years. Jessika is facing challenges in her studies as she is having to study and work. There is a lot of attrition in the universities because people cannot pay for their tuition, schooling, etc. She lives in the area Villa La Merced. Her desire is to finish her career after she finishes her studies and improve the quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to finance costs of her studies such as enrollment fees and materials.

loans.name: Los Jardines Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras uno de ellos es Luis un hombre luchador de 54 años de edad, casado, con tres hijos, su negocio es la venta de perecederos en el mercado municipal  de Masaya desde hace 22 años se dedica a este actividad económica, tiene de ser cliente de la institución 7 años. Solicita el crédito  nuevamente para  la compra de sacos tomate, cebolla, chiltoma, ajo, papa, zanahoria, repollo, lechuga, etc. Juana mujer de 49 años su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras, Gilma mujer de 42años su negocio es la venta de perecederos.
texts.en:
The Los Jardines [The Gardens] Solidarity Group consists of three hardworking members. One is Luis, a determined, 54-year-old man who is married with three children. Luis has sold produce at the municipal market in Masaya for 22 years. 

Luis has been a client of the lending institution for seven years, and is applying for a loan to purchase bags of tomatoes, onions, sweet peppers, garlic, potatoes, carrots, cabbage, lettuce, and other crops. 

The other members of the Los Jardines Group are Juana, who is 49 and sells fruits and vegetables; and Gilma, who is 42 and also sells produce.

loans.use: to purchase bags of tomatoes, onions, sweet peppers, garlic, potatoes, carrots, cabbage, lettuce, and other crops.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana, necesita más capital para aumentar el negocio comprara jabón, frijol, maíz, azúcar, sal, etc. Ya que el crédito anterior le ayudo a  aumentar un poco más los ingresos, con los que pudo establecer una tienda en su casa también le ayudo a cancelar sus deudas y atraer más clientes.
Su deseo es ampliar más su tienda, continuar con la venta de ropa y darle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia. Todos se encuentran saludabes.
texts.en:
Diana needs additional capital to grow her business. She will use the funds from this loan to purchase soap, beans, corn, sugar, salt, and other goods. Diana's previous loan gave a small boost to her income and allowed her to set up a shop in her home, pay off her debts, and attract more customers. 

Diana's ambition is to expand her store, continue to sell clothing, and provide a better standard of living for her family. Fortunately, all of the family members are in good health.

loans.use: to purchase soap, beans, corn, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 40 years old and married with three children. She runs a fish business in Jui, eastern area, in Freetown.

She's been in this business for ten years and sells fish within her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is the sometimes slow purchasing power.

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and educate her children. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business more than ever. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, sugar, and salt, to expand her business,

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Meet 21-year-old Emma from Jui in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with no children right now.  In 2008, Emma established a retail business. She began her business because she wanted to create a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She is very hard working and desires to improve her standard of living

Emma requires a loan to purchase rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and attend a vocational training school. In the future, Emma plans to become a caterer. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coal by the bag.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Mariatu from Jui, eastern area, in Freetown. She is single with one child. 

Ten years ago, Mariatu established her slipper business. She began her business because she wanted to create a source of income for her living.  She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of capital to expand her business.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase slippers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Lissette Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lissette de  37 años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos de 10,7 anos, es originaria de  Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central del país. Ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal.  En la actualidad, por su perseverancia, confianza disciplina su negocio ha crecido y ha sido la forma de vida de sus pequeños  hijos.  Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar, ya que se dedica a trabajar desde muy joven. 
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos varios y  plásticos para el hogar como: retrateras, perchas, selladores, pega, platos y vasos plásticos, manteles, pastes de baño, cortinas de baño. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su negocio. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos varios  y plásticos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Lissette agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Lissette is 37 years old and a single mother of two children, ages 10 and 7. She is a native of Managua, which is in the central part of the country. Lissette is described as a responsible and hard-working person who wants to better herself. Her business has grown because of her perseverance, confidence and discipline, and it currently supports her two young children. Sadly, Lissette was not able to go to school because she had to start working at a young age.

Thanks to her hard work and her desire to get ahead, Lissette has a business selling various household items and plastic products such as picture frames, clothes hangers, sealant, glue, plastic plates and cups, tablecloths, body scrubbers and shower curtains. Lissette spends twelve hours each day working at her business and offering her products. She says that she enjoys this work very much.

Lissette is requesting this loan to invest in working capital and to stock her business with the household items and plastic products she sells. She hopes that this will improve her income in the near future. Lissette is grateful to Kiva lenders for the help they give to people with limited resources in developing countries like Nicaragua so that they can have meaningful work.

loans.use: to buy various household items and plastic products to sell, such as picture frames, clothes hangers, sealant, glue, plastic plates and cups, tablecloths, body scrubbers and shower curtains.

loans.name: Zuliaka

texts.en:
Zuliaka is single with one child, and she goes to school. She cares for one additional family member. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes bills and feeding the family. 

Zuliaka sells used clothes on a retail basis at the market, and she has been in this business for 10 years. She works six days a week. 

Zuliaka has applied for a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to have permanent premises for her business.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Hakilitoyerela Group

texts.fr: Les six  femmes du groupe Hakilitoyerela sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sando-Sido dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
