Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce du beurre de karité, du lait, d’arachide et du mil. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Bintou (1èrefemme debout  à droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de beurre de karité dans le le village  de Sando-Sido. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une très grande quantité de beurre de karité à Ségou pour  la satisfaction du besoin de sa clientèle. La revente se fait au comptant  à la maison et au marché à une clientèle mixe. Madame Bintou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et élargir ses activités.
texts.en:
The six members of the Hakilitoyerela group are women who are mainly married in monogamous households. They average 28 years of age and three children each. They all live in the district of Sando-Sido in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali). They know one another as neighbors, through ties of kinship, and through the income-generating activities they conduct in the village. They sell shea butter, milk, groundnuts and millet. 

To bolster their working capital, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance organization. This is their first group loan cycle. 

Mrs. Bintou (standing 1st on the right) is a prominent seller of shea butter in the village of Sando-Sido. She plans to use her loan to buy a very large quantity of shea butter in Ségou to meet customer demand. She sells her stock to a mixed clientele for cash, from her home and at the market. 

With this loan, Mrs. Bintou expects to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000FCFA, which she will use to provide for her children’s needs and to expand her activities.

loans.use: to buy shea butter.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret is single with four children, two of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family. 

Gorret operates a kiosk at the market. She sells her products retail and wholesale. She has been in business for 13 years, and she works seven days a week.  

Gorret has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy sugar, rice, soap, biscuits, sweets, and cooking oil. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to have permanent premises for her business and to open another kiosk.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, sweets, and biscuits

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
Hang was born in 1974. She is now living with her family in Bac Ninh. She has three children who are learning at the secondary school, high school and university level. Her husband is a carpenter. She sells fruit to earn a living and also works as a farmer. She earns about 6,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for ten years. Her family’s total income is 14,000,000 VND. Her challenge in life and work is the lack of capital to buy wood for her husband’s carpentry work. Her dream is to expand her business so her children can be successful in life. This loan is one of the steps to help her achieve this dream. Hang is a hard-working and dynamic woman. She also has a passion for her job. She said that with this job she can make more money to earn a living and have more time to take care of her family. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 10,080,000 VND and repaid on time. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 10,976,000 VND to buy wood for crusting and to sell fruit. She has always wanted to expand her business and save profits for her children’s education.

Other members who are part of Hang's group include the following:
Dung is 32-years-old. She has two children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 10,080,000 VND for crusting.
Giang is 31-years-old. She has a child. She sells drinks and does carpentry work to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to sell drinks.
Phuong is 21-years-old. She has a child. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to do carpentry work.
Ngan is 54-years-old. She has three children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to raise chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to buy wood for her husband's carpentry work and to sell fruit.

loans.name: Apocalipsis 4.35 Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios exitosos uno de ellos es Rosa tiene la edad de 21 años, acompañada,  su negocio es la venta de ropa y taller de zapatería. Sus productos los comercializa  en su comunidad y alrededores  desde hace 3 años, el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de ropa como blusas, camisetas, camisas, pantalones, shores, para la elaboración de zapatos necesita forro, pega, suelas, brasil, adornos. Diederich tiene la edad  de 20 años su negocio es un taller de zapatería, María tiene la edad de 23 años su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y bisutería.
texts.en:
This group consists of three successful partners. One is Rosa, who is 21, married, and runs a combination of two businesses: she sells clothing and operates a shoemaker's workshop. Rosa has sold shoes and clothing in her community and neighboring towns for three years. She is applying for a loan to purchase clothing - such as blouses, shirts, pants, and shorts - as well as supplies for making shoes: linings, glue, soles, Brazil wood, and adornments. 

Diedrich is another member of the group. He is 20 years old and also operates a shoemaker's shop. María is 23 and also sells clothing and operates a shoemaker's workshop.

loans.use: El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de ropa como blusas, camisetas, camisas, pantalones, shores, para la elaboración de zapatos necesita forro, pega, suelas, brasil, adornos.

loans.name: Filipenses 4.13 Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores exitosos uno de ellos es María tiene la edad de 35 años, casada, su negocio es la venta de refrescos naturales en su domicilio, tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad 8 años. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de materia prima como es frutas de calala, pitahaya, linaza, chía, melón, piña, granadilla, cacao, avena, azúcar, bolsas, pajillas, especies, etc. Martin hombre de 55 años su negocio es la venta de ropa y Rafaela de 49 años de edad su negocio es la venta de zapatos
texts.en:
This group is made up of three successful entrepreneurs, one of whom is María, 35. She is married and has a business selling natural soft drinks from her home. She has had this business for eight years. She is applying for this loan to buy ingredients and supplies such as passionfruit, dragon fruit, linseeds, chia seeds, melons, pineapples, sweet granadillas, cocoa, oats, sugar, bags, straws, spices, etc. 

Martin, 55, has a business selling clothes. Rafaela, 49, has a business selling shoes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies such as passionfruit, dragon fruit, linseed, chia seeds, melons, pineapples, sweet granadillas, cocoa, oats, sugar, bags, straws, spices, etc.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet Mariama, a 30-year-old from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is single for now.  In 2006, Mariama established her assorted drinks business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income.   She works at the business from 8:00 AM until 7:00 PM, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mariama requires a loan in order to purchase more assorted drinks and pure water to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Mariama plans to open a food-stuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more assorted drinks and pure water to expand her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is a married 28-year-old woman with 3 children. She runs a cooking business in Jui Eastern area in Freetown. She began this business to provide for her children's welfare.

She has been in this business for 8 years and sells food locally.  She says that the main business problem is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more seasonings, rice and cooking oil to expand her resale business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business even more. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more seasonings, rice and cooking oil to expand her resale business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Rosaline from the Jui Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children. For the past 5 years, Rosaline has operated a medical drugs business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself. She works from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She is very hard-working and desires to improve her standard of living

Rosaline requires a loan in order to purchase drugs such as blood syrup, malaria drugs, and pain relievers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to start a savings account and increase her business. In the future, Rosaline plans to expand her business further. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase drugs such as blood syrup, malaria drugs, and pain relievers to expand her business.

loans.name: El Bien Comun Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres miembros uno de ellos es José hombre de 65 años, casado, con tres hijos, su negocio es la venta de tortillas y leche agria en su comunidad ambulante desde hace 3 años. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de vasos descartables, cucharas descartables, leche, tortillas. Juanita mujer de 38 años su negocio es una pulpería y Danelia mujer de 37 años su negocio es una pulpería.
texts.en:
Part of a group composed of three members, José is a 65-year-old man, married and with three children. His business is the itinerant sale of tortillas and sour milk in his community, which he has done for 3 years. He requires the loan to buy disposable cups and spoons, milk and tortillas. 

The other people in the group are Juanita, a 38-year-old woman with a general store, and Danelia, a 37-year-old woman also with a general store.

loans.use: to buy disposable cups and spoons, milk and tortillas

loans.name: Jose Manrique

texts.es:
José, hará mejoras a su vivienda y dará mantenimiento a su vehículo, con la inversión comprara cemento, ladrillos, arena, llantas, aceite y otros, con el crédito anterior compro hierro para su taller y reparo su auto, lo que le dio más ingresos, con los que cancelo su crédito y aumento sus ingresos.
Con la buena administración él ha conseguido brindar un apoyo constante a su familia, la cual se mantiene con el mismo número de integrantes, todos están muy saludables.
texts.en:
José will make improvements to his home and give maintenance to his vehicle, in particular using the loan he will buy cement, bricks, sand, tyres, oil and others. With his previous loan he bough iron for his workshop and repaired his car, improving his income, which he used to pay his loan.

Thanks to his good financial management he has managed to provide continuous support for his family, which is of a constant size. They are all very healthy.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, tyres, oil and others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more children's used clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Aminata from Waterloo, Western rural area, in Freetown. She is married with three children. Her children are currently attending school. 

Ten years ago, Aminata established her wax cotton business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business twelve hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, Aminata plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more lappa (fabric), blouses and slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Por Fe Group

texts.es: Este grupo se conforman de cuatro socias exitosas una de ellas es Cruz tiene la edad de 44 años, casada, con un hijo bajo su responsabilidad, su negocio es la elaboración y venta de ropa en su domicilio desde hace 15 años, posee tres trabajadores que le ayudan a elaboración de la ropa. Tiene 5 años de ser cliente de la institución lo que ha demostrado que es una persona muy responsable en sus cuotas, Está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para  la compra de materiales como rollo de telas, hilos, agujas, elásticos, botones, zippers, etc. Ruth tiene la edad de 50 años, su negocio es la venta de ropa, Isabel tiene 29 años su negocio es la venta de carne de cerdo y nacatamales, Martha tiene la edad de 41 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y ropa.
texts.en:
This group is formed by four successful members. One of them is Cruz, who is 44 years old and married with a son in her care. For the last 15 years, her business has been making and selling clothing in her home. She has three workers who help her make clothing.

She has been a client of the institution for 5 years, which has demonstrated that she is a very responsible person with her payments. She is again asking for a loan for the purchase of materials like rolls of fabrics, thread, needles, elastic, buttons, zippers, etc.

Ruth is 50 years old and her business is the sale of clothing. Isabel is 29 years old and her business is the sale of pork and tamales. Martha is 41 years old and her business is the sale of cosmetics and clothing.

loans.use: to buy materials like rolls of fabrics, thread, needles, elastic, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por  cuatro socias emprendedoras exitosas una de ellas es Karla tiene 24 años, casada, con dos hijos menores, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y ropa ambulante, sus productos los ofrece en su comunidad y alrededores desde hace 1 año y medio. Está solicitando el crédito para la compra calzado de diferentes estilos cerrados, para adultos, niños, sandalias, etc. Bersabe mujer de 51 años su negocio es la venta de ropa, recarga y hielo, Elizabeth mujer de 38 años su negocio es una mini pulpería, Flor de María mujer de 27  su negocio es una mini pulpería.
texts.en:
A group composed of four entrepreneurial and successful partners, one of whom is Karla who is 24 years old, married, with two young children. Her business is the itinerant sale of cosmetics and clothes. She has been selling her products in her community and its surroundings for one year and a half. She is requesting this loan to buy footwear of different styles: closed, for adults, for children, sandals, etc.

The other members of the group are Bersabe, a 51-year-old woman whose business is the sale of clothes, mobile phone credit and ice; Elizabeth, a 38-year-old woman whose business is a small general store; and Flor de María, a 27-year-old woman whose business is a small general store.

loans.use: to buy footwear of different styles: closed, for adults, for children, sandals, etc.

loans.name: Molinos De Vientos Group

texts.es: Cuatro son los socios que forman este grupo solidario uno de ellos es Hurit tiene la edad de 23 años, casada, con un hijo menor, se dedica al destace de cerdo en su domicilio desde hace 6 años. el crédito lo está requiriendo para la comprar de cerdo en pie y compra de mercadería de ropa como pantalones, blusas, camisas, camisetas, shore, etc. Emérita mujer de 40 años de edad su negocio es la venta de desayunos, Erika mujer de 26 años su negocio es la venta de ropa y Yerika tiene 21 años su negocio es la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Four are the members of this solidary group, one of whom is Hurit, 23 years old, married and with a young child, she has made a living as a pork butcher from her home for 6 years now. They are requesting the loan to buy live pigs and to buy clothes for sale, such as pants, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, shorts, etc.

The other members of the group are: Emérita, a 40-year-old woman whose business is the sale of breakfasts; Erika, a 26-year-old woman whose business is the sale of clothes; and Yerika who is 21 years old and whose business is the sale of clothes.

loans.use: to buy live pigs and to buy clothes for sale, such as pants, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es: El grupo Primavera está formado por cuatro miembros uno de ellos es Elizabeth mujer de 27 años, casada, con dos hijos menores, su negocio es la venta de ropa y calzado ambulante en el mercado oriental, tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad 8 años, solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como pantalones varón, pantalones de damas, blusas americanas, Blúmeres, brasieres, zapatos cerrados y sandalias de diferentes estilos. Ervin tiene 24 años se dedica a la venta de accesorios para vehículo, Yessenia mujer de 35 años se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción y Martha tiene 50 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa y electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
The Primavera [Spring] group is composed of four members, one of whom is Elizabeth, a 27-year-old woman, married and with two small children. Her business is the itinerant sale of clothes and footwear in the oriental market, which she has been doing for 8 years. She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise, such as men's pants, women's pants, american blouses, sweaters, brassieres, closed shoes and sandals of different styles.

The other members of the group: Ervin, 24 years old, makes a living from the sale of vehicle accessories; Yessenia, a 35-year-old woman, makes a living from the sale of construction materials; and Martha, 50 years old, makes a living from the sale of clothes and home appliances.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as men's pants, women's pants, american blouses, sweaters, brassieres, closed shoes and sandals of different styles

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children.  For the past six years, Fatmata has established a hairdressing business. She began her business because she wants to create an income to take care of her family.  She works at her business from 8:00am until 6:00pm, six days a week. She says that the main challenge to her business is low customer rate.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more cosmetics and hair products to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and open a big salon. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and hair products to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients such as pepper, fish, onions, spices, and meat

loans.name: Fudia         V

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Fudia from Jui, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married with one child.  For the past five years, Fudia has established a retail business. She began her business because she did not have money to empower herself.  She works at her business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days a week. She works very hard and desires to improve her standard of living.

Fudia requires a loan in order to purchase more toothpaste, cigarettes, soap and drinks to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Fudia plans to further expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more toothpaste, cigarettes, soap and drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet Rugiatu. She is in her late thirties and is from Waterloo, eastern area, in Freetown. She is married with four children.  

Fifteen years ago, Rugiatu established her entertainment business. She began her business because she wants to generate income to support her children. She works at the business from 1:00 p.m. until 10:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to purchase soft drinks and pure water to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and build a permanent business structure. 

In the future, Rugiatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and pure water to expand her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is single with two children who both go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells milk on a retail basis at the market. She has been in business for six years and works six days a week. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy jerrycans of milk, bread, and Blue Band (spread). Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to get a better fridge for storing milk. She resides in a rented house. The family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy jerrycans of milk, bread, and Blue Band (spread).

loans.name: Ana Beyky

texts.es: Ana es una mujer emprendedora de 30 años de edad, soltera, su negocio es la compra y venta de cosecha, vende sus productos en el mercado municipal de Masaya y en un puesto que tiene en la salida de Masaya. Tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad económica 7 años, actualmente cuenta con tres ayudantes. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de cosechas de tamarindo , mango y nancite.
texts.en: Ana is an enterprising woman.  She is 30 years old and single.  Her business is buying and selling harvested crops.  She sells her products at the Masaya municipal market and at a stand that she has at the Masaya exit.  She has been engaged in this business activity for seven years.  She currently has three helpers.  She needs the loan to buy tamarind, mango, and ‘nancite’ [a Nicaraguan berry] crops.

loans.use: to buy tamarind, mango, and ‘nancite’ [a Nicaraguan berry] crops.

loans.name: Unidas En Cristo Group

texts.es: Tres son las socias que conforman el grupo una de ellas es Mary tiene la edad de 26 años, acompañada, su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 6 meses, sus productos los comercializa en su comunidad y alrededores. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de mercadería como blusas, camisas, pantalones de varón, pantalones de damas, camisetas, shores, etc. Ana mujer de 60 años su negocio es la venta de derivados del maíz como pinol, pinolillo, semilla de jícaro, Yubenia tiene 18 años su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three members, one of whom is Mary, 26. She is in a relationship and has had a business selling new clothing for six months. She sells her products in her village and the surrounding area. She has applied for this loan to buy merchandise such as blouses, shirts, men's and women's pants, T-shirts, shorts, etc. 

Ana, 60, has a business selling corn products such as pinolillo (a drink made of cocoa and roasted cornmeal) and gourd seeds. Yubenia, 18, has a business selling new clothing.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as blouses, shirts, men's and women's pants, T-shirts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is a 38-year-old married mother of four children between the age of eight and five years. She runs a domestic products business selling glass cups, knives and food containers in Waterloo, located in the eastern area in Freetown. She started the business to improve her family's living conditions. Her main obstacle is a poor business location.

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. Isatu is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and food containers for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo 2, eastern area, in Freetown. She is married with eight children between the ages of 7 years and 25 years.  She started her business to get her daily survival for her family.
 
Kadiatu runs a cookery business. She sells cookery within her area and has been running this business since 2000. She works at the business twelve hours per day and six days per week.  Kadiatu says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to buy food commodities like cooking seasonings, oil and rice to prepare in her cookery business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. 

In the future, she plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food commodities like cooking seasonings, oil and rice to prepare in her cookery business.

loans.name: Martir Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socios luchadores uno de ellos es Mártir tiene la edad de 37 años, acompañada, con cinco hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio desde hace 9 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 5 años, el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de inventario como  arroz, azúcar, aceite, café, huevo, papel higiénico, maruchan, big cola, leche, queso, crema, etc. Josefa tiene 40 años su negocio es la venta de zapatos en Masatepe y en su comunidad, Neyton tiene 25 años su negocio es la venta de nacatamales en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The Martir group is made up of three hard-working members. One of them is Martir, who is 37 years old, in a relationship, and has five children under his care. Martir has had a business for nine years, which is a small grocery store located in his home.

Martir has been a client of the field partner for five years. He will use this loan to buy inventory for his store such as rice, sugar, oil, coffee, eggs, toilet paper, ramen noodles, Big Cola [a brand of cola], milk, cheese, cream and other groceries. 

Josefa is 40 years old and sells shoes in Masatepe and in her town. Neyton is 25 years old and sells nacatamales [Nicaraguan tamales] from his home.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his store such as rice, sugar, oil, coffee, eggs, toilet paper, ramen noodles, Big Cola [a brand of cola], milk, cheese, cream and other groceries.

loans.name: Yerald Augusto

texts.es: Yerald es un hombre luchador de 33 años de edad, casado, con un hijo, su negocio es taller de calzado desde hace 20 años, actualmente le trabajan 6 personas que hacen el proceso del calzado terminado. Tiene 4 años de ser cliente de la institución. Está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de materiales como es cuero, suelas, pega, hilo, forro, adornos, esponja, etc.
texts.en:
Yerard is a tenacious man.  He is 33 years old, married, and he has one child.  He has had his shoe repair shop for 20 years.  There are currently six people who work with him in the process of finishing the footwear.  He has been a client of the institution for four years.

He is once again requesting a loan to buy materials like leather, soles, glue, thread, lining, and sponges, etc.

loans.use: to buy materials like leather, soles, glue, thread, lining, and sponges, etc.

loans.name: Dios  De Pacto Group

texts.es: Grupo integrado por tres socios microempresarios uno de ellos Yasmina tiene la edad de 24 años, casada, su negocio es la elaboración de artesanía de bambú, comercializa sus productos en el mercado de Masaya, tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad desde hace 15 años. El crédito lo está requiriendo para la compra de bambú, mano de obra y transporte. Juan tiene la edad de 20 años su negocio es artesanía de bambú y María mujer de 54 años su negocio es la elaboración y venta de artesanía de bambú.
texts.en: This micro-enterprise is made up of three members, one of whom is Yasima. She is twenty-four years old and married. Her business consists of making bamboo handicrafts. She sells her products at the Masaya market. She has been in this business for fifteen years. She is asking for this loan to buy bamboo and pay for labor and transportation costs. Juan is twenty years old and his business is the making of bamboo handicrafts, and Maria, a fifty-four year old woman, has a business making and selling bamboo handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy bamboo and pay for labor and transportation costs.

loans.name: Kotankegne Group

texts.fr: Les quatre femmes du groupe Kotankegne sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sando-Sido dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce des condiments et du mil. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle du prêt solidaire.Madame Minata (1ère femme debout  à gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment dans le village  de Sando-Sido. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une très grande quantité de condiment à Ségou  pour  la satisfaction du besoin de sa clientèle. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit  à la maison et au marché à une clientèle mixe. Madame Minata S. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et élargir ses activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Kotankegne are married, mostly in monogamous households. They average 34 years old and four children each. They live together in the Sando-Sido region of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other through neighborhood ties, friendship, and commerce. They have a small business for spices and millet. In order to grow their business, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan. 

Minata S (first woman standing on the left) is a great seller of spices in the Sando-Sido village. She plans to use the loan to buy large quantities of spices at Ségou to satisfy customer needs. She resells it for cash and credit at home and at the market to a mixed customer base. Minata S hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 f CFA with this loan, which will be used to take care of the children's needs and to grow the business.

loans.use: to buy spices

loans.name: Alma Del Socorro

texts.es: Alma es una mujer  emprendedora de 59 años de edad, soltera,con dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de muebles y artesanía, comercializa sus productos en Managua desde hace 30 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 4 años. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de inventario como jugueteras, hamacas, sillas, esquineras, etc.
texts.en: Alma is an enterprising woman of 59 years. She is single and has two children. Her business is selling furniture and handicrafts. She has been selling her products in Managua for 30 years. She has belonged to ADIM for 4 years. The loan Alma is requesting will be used to buy inventory like shelves, hammocks, chairs, corner cabinets etc.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, shelves, chairs, corner cupboards etc.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Meet 20-year-old Marian from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children. In 2009, Marian established her wood stove business.  She began her business because she wants to improve her family. She works at the business nine hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Marian requires a loan in order to purchase more equipment to expand her stove business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and change her status of living. In the future, Marian plans to buy a plot of land. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment to expand her stove business.

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marina de 39 años de edad,  es casada y madre de 6 hijos. Por motivos de pobreza no estudio y se dedicó mejor a trabajar en la casa, a los oficios domésticos, y a trabajar en el campo en la agricultura, y al cuido de algunos animales domésticos, los cuales son, gallinas, cerdos. En el cuido de ganado, tiene más de 25 años de hacerlo. Su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, tiene 6 hijos 3 viven con ella en la casa y los otros 3 están acompañados, 2 de los que viven con ella están estudiando 4° y 5° grado.

Ella se dedica al cuido de animales domésticos, como gallinas, patos, ella tiene 25 años de dedicarse a este trabajo, ya que lo aprendo gracias a  su mamá, la cual  la instruyo en estos oficios,  ella realiza este trabajo en su casa, sus hijos también le ayudan al cuido de estos animales.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para la recolección de su cosecha de maíz y frijoles, y pagar mano de obra, ya que este producto ellos lo agarrean en caballos hasta su casa y el costo de cada viaje es de $5 dólares.  Además, paga mosos para que recolecten la cosecha y les paga a $ 7 dólares los 437.50 metros cuadrados, y tiene sembradas 13,125 metros cuadrados. 

Marina a futuro desea tener alimento para su familia durante el año. Además, del resto que le sobra lo venderá para ayudarle a sus hijos en otros gastos, ya que ella también tiene sus 2 hijos estudiando y necesita comprarles, útiles escolares, y más para fortalecer el aprendizaje de ellos, ya que los sueños de Marina es ayudarle a estos 2 hijos, para que en un futuro sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Marina, 39 years old, is married and mother of 6 children. Because of her family's poverty, she did not go to school and instead dedicated herself to working at home doing domestic labor, working in the fields doing agriculture, and caring for small livestock such as chickens and pigs. She has been caring for livestock for more than 25 years. Her husband also works in agriculture. They have 6 children; 3 live with her at home and the other 3 live with their partners. 2 of those who live with her are in school in 4th and 5th grade. 

She cares for small livestock such as chickens and ducks. She has been doing this work for 25 years. She learned thanks to her mother, who taught her this work. She works at home, and her children also help her care for the animals. 

The loan she is requesting is to harvest her corn and beans and pay for laborers, as she brings her products home by horse and each trip costs $5. She also pays people to reap the harvest, and she pays them $7 per 437.50 square meters; she has sown 13,125 square meters. 

In the future, Marina wants to have food for her family all year. As well, she will sell what she has left over to help her children with their expenses, as she has two children in school and she must buy them school supplies and other things to support their learning. Marina's dream is to support these two children so that they can be professionals in the future.

loans.use: to reap the harvest of her corn and beans and pay for laborers.

loans.name: Ulguzi

texts.ru: Улгузи молодая женщина из района Шахритус. Ей 30 лет. Она начинает свой бизнес по покупке и продаже крупнорогатых скотов. У нее дома имеется 3 коровы. Улгузи использует их, чтобы обеспечить свою семью молоком. Теперь Улгузи с помощью кредита намерена закупить несколько голов скотов и начать бизнес. Ей будут помогать ее семья. Улгузи будет держать своих бычков, телят и коров на скотном дворе при наступлении зимы, они будут жить в коровнике. Улгузи целеустремленная женщина надеемся, что ее ждет удача.
texts.en: Ulguzi is a young woman from the Shahrituz district. She is thirty years old, and beginning her own business buying and selling cattle. She currently has three cows on her property which provide milk for her family. Now, Ulguzi intends to use a loan to buy a few head of cattle and start a business. Her family will help her. She is going to keep her steers, calves, and cows in her livestock yard and when winter comes they will live in a small barn. Ulguzi is a purposeful woman and we wish her the best of luck.

loans.use: Buy bull calves

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru:
Акбар считает себя самым счастливым человеком, потому что он женат на любимой девушке, у них есть дети и общая работа. У Акбара имеется маленький продуктовый магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Его супруга помогает ему в работе. 
   3 года назад Акбар решился открыть свой продуктовый магазин. Для начала такая работа являлось ему только средством дохода, чтобы обеспечить семью, но сейчас работа в магазине это еще и любимое занятие. За 3 года Акбар приобрел опыт и постоянных клиентов. Он хочет привести новые продукты и расширить ассортимент товара в магазине. Для закупа и перевозки продуктов питания потребуются деньги, поэтому Акбар обратился за кредитом. Он надеется, что ему помогут. Акбар ждет Вашей помощи!
texts.en:
Akbar considers himself the luckiest man, because he is married to his favorite girl, they have children and a general job. Akbar has a small grocery store where he sells foodstuffs. His wife helps him at work.

Three years ago Akbar decided to open his grocery store. To begin with this work was his only source of income to provide for his family, but now the work in the store is still his favorite activity. For three years Akbar gained experience and loyal customers. He wants to lead a new grocery store and to expand his assortment of goods in his store. Money is required to buy and trade food products, because of this Akbar is requesting a loan. He hopes that you will help him. Akbar is waiting for your help!

loans.use: To expand the selection of products in the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more body powder, cream, grease, bath soap, under clothes and spry for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Meet 57-year-old Precilla from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with eight children. In 2008, Precilla established her charcoal business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support her home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price changes.

Precilla requires a loan to buy more wood and charcoal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Precilla plans to change her business to a big provisions shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more wood and charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Salamatu from Waterloo2 Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with eight children. She began her business because she wants to be independent and educate her children. For the past thirteen years, Salamatu has run her general store.  She works at the business twelve hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, juice, and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and develop her family. In the future, Salamatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, juice, and pure water

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children. In 2001, Fatmata established her general store. She began her business because she wants to empower herself and her children. She works at the business twelve hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, drinks, pure water, and wax cotton. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Fatmata plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, drinks, pure water, and wax cotton

loans.name: Yeanoh

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 25-year-old Yeanoh from Waterloo2 eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with two children. She started this business to take care of her family. 

Yeanoh runs a food stand at home; she sells rice, onions, and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Yeanoh says that the main challenge to her business is price transportation and insufficient finance to expand her business.

Yeanoh has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, onions, and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, onions, and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: María Rómula

texts.es: María, una madre soltera de 36 años de edad, se dedica desde hace 8 años a vender productos por catálogo, actividad que conoció gracias a una amiga que le enseñó todo lo relacionado con esta labor y, poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia y su propia clientela; trabaja todos los días, aunque no tiene un horario de trabajo establecido y, de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su familia ya que es madre cabeza de hogar. Su empuje, entusiasmo y su dinamismo la impulsan a solicitar el apoyo del crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido al por mayor (cosméticos, cremas corporales, perfumería, accesorios, entre otros), de esta forma podrá aprovechar los descuentos y promociones que obtiene, disminuyendo así los costos de los productos y, logrando aumentar el margen de ganancia con cada venta, además podrá satisfacer la demanda de productos que aumenta en la temporada de fin  de año, mejorando así los ingresos que recibe por su labor. De esta forma María quiere seguir luchando, para sobrepasar los diversos obstáculos que se le presentan y enfrentar su principal desafío que es la dificultad para trasladarse a todos los sectores por lo que más adelante quiere tener un vehículo que le facilite el transporte; además quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y en un futuro poder cumplir el sueño de adquirir un local propio donde pueda vender todo tipo de artículos, además brindar oportunidades de empleo y así, mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar familiar.
texts.en: María is a 36 year old single mother. For the past 8 years she has been selling products from catalogs. She was taught this by a friend who taught her everything about this activity.  Little by little she has acquired experience and her own clientele. She works every day but does not have a fixed schedule. In this manner she generates enough revenue to cover the household expenses as she is the head of the household. Her drive, enthusiasm and dynamism have motivated her to request a loan to help her invest in buying stock at wholesale (cosmetics, body creams, perfume, accessories, etc.) In this way she can take advantage of discounts and promotions reducing the cost of her product. She can increases her profit margin with each sale and she can meet the customer demand which is always high at the end of the year. This will increase the income she makes for her labor.In this way María will continue to struggle overcoming the obstacles put in her way and face the main challenge she has. Which is getting to the various areas to sell. In the future she would like to own a vehicle to make transportation easier. She would also like to continue investing in her business and in the future fulfill the dream of owning her own premises where she could sell all types of products, creating more employment opportunities and raising her family's quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (cosmetics, body creams, perfume, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Jesus Es El Camino Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socios microempresarios uno de ellos es Jennifer tiene la edad de 22 años, acompañada, su negocio es la venta de leña ambulante y por encargo, Ella solicita nuevamente crédito para la compra de fletes de leña. Kenia tiene la edad de 24 años su negocio es un taller donde elaboran y repara camas, además vende colchones, Alexander tiene 31 años su negocio es la venta de leña.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 3 micro-entrepreneurs. One of them is Jennifer who is 22 years old. She is married. Her business is the sale of wood both door to door and by custom order. She is requesting another loan to buy loads of wood. 

Kenia is 24 years old and she makes and repairs beds and also sells mattresses. Alexander is 31 and he sells wood.

loans.use: to buy loads of wood.

loans.name: La Aurora Group

texts.es: El grupo lo forman tres socias emprendedoras de éxitos una de ellas es Indiana mujer de 35 años casada, con dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de perecederos desde hace 3 años en el mercado de Masaya. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de frijoles por quintal, sacos de papa y cebolla. Elizabeth tiene 27 años su negocio es la venta de perecederos desde hace 2 años y Rosa tiene 24 años su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Three entrepreneurial partners make up the Las Auroras Group. Indiana is 35, married, and the mother of two children. She has run a business selling produce for three years at the Masaya city market. Indiana is applying for a loan to purchase beans by the quintal [100 lbs.] and bags of potatoes and onions. 

The other group members are Elizabeth, who is 27 and has run a business selling produce for two years; and Rosa, who is 24 and runs a business selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase beans by the quintal [100 lbs.] and bags of potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, biscuits, candy, and sardine for her business;

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Isatu from Waterloo2 in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 14 years old.  In 2010, Isatu established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wanted to generate her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business and the poor road network.

Isatu requires a loan to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Isatu plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Yeabu from Waterloo2 in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married and blessed with six children.  She began her business because she wanted to improve her family. In 1995, Yeabu established her general stock business.  She works at the business for nine hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Yeabu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Yeabu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and pure water to sell

loans.name: Bera Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es: Bera de 50 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 12 años de edad. Junto a su esposo mantiene la economía de su hogar y dan a su hijo lo necesario. Bera tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a la venta de mariscos en las diferentes zonas de su localidad y de esta forma lleva el sustento a su familia. Su casa es muy sencilla pero propia y poco a poco va mejorando. Desea construir el corredor y cambiar el piso de la casa el cual se encuentra deteriorado. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para hacer la inversión en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, arena y cemento ya que son los materiales necesarios para las mejoras que requiere la vivienda.
texts.en:
Bera is 50 years old. She lives in her own home along with her husband and a 12 year old son. Together with her husband they support the household and provide what is necessary for their son. Bera has been selling seafood in the different neighborhoods of her community for a long time now. 

Their house is very simple but little by little they have been improving it. They want to build a corridor and replace the flooring which has deteriorated. For this reason Bera has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying galvanized sheeting, wood, sand and cement. These are the materials they need to make the improvements on their home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, wood, sand and cement to construct a corridor and replace the floors in the house.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin es un señor de 42 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos, ellos viven en el Caserío Peña Blanca, departamento de Sololá
El se dedica al cultivo de cebolla, esta actividad la heredó de sus padres desde su niñez y la realiza en su comunidad y es el medio por el cual el obtiene la totalidad de sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia. Cuenta que lo que realiza es algo que a el le gusta bastante porque le ayuda a estar en contacto con la naturaleza. Lleva 20 años realizando esta labor.
El solicita un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de semilla de cebolla y fertilizante para la siembra y el mantenimiento.
Martin sueña con mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para brindarle a su familia una vida más digna.
texts.en:
Martin is 42 years old. He is married and he has two children. They live in the Peña Blanca community in the Sololá department. 
He grows onions. He inherited this skill from his parents during childhood. He works in his community. This is the means by which he obtains all of his resources to support his family. He says that he is doing something that he likes a lot since it helps him to say in touch with nature. He has been farming for 20 years. He is requesting a loan for 3,000.00 GTQ to purchase onion seeds and fertilizers for the land and maintenance.

loans.use: purchase onion seeds and fertilizers for the land and maintenance

loans.name: San Marcos Caiquin Group

texts.es: Ma Eusebia, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en un municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos y hortalizas. lleva varios años de tener su propio cultivo de café y granos básicos en menor escala. Su mayor fuente de ingresos sale del cultivo de café que vende despulpado en el mercado local. El prestamo que solicita es el cuarto ciclo y es en forma grupal, por 12,000 lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a la finca de café, y poder tener mejores cosechas y ganancias. Su meta es darle una mejor educación a sus hijos y mejor calidad de vida. El grupo se llama San Marcos Caiquin y esta integrado por 11 personas de la comunidad, quienes se dedican a la agricultura y caficultura, El préstamo total grupal es por 59,000 Lempiras, con el cual van a fertilizar el cultivo de café. En la foto al lado izquierdo de la fila de atrás se encuentra Ma Eusebia, sigue Ledly, Francisco, Pedro y José Teodoro, en frente a la izquierda esta José, María, José Inés, José Manuel, Santos y Armando a la derecha.
texts.en: Ma Eusebia is 42 years old. She is married and has four children. She lives in the town of Gracias, Lempira. She has always worked in farming, growing basic grains and vegetables. For several years she has had her own coffee and basic grains crops on a small scale. Her biggest source of income is from the coffee crop that she sells pulped in the local market. The loan she is asking for is the group's fourth cycle and is for 12,000 lempiras. She is going to invest it in buying fertilizer to do maintenance on the coffee farm so she can have better harvests and earnings. Her goal is a better education and quality of life for her children. The group is called San Marcos Caiquin and is made up of 11 people in the community who work in agriculture and coffee culture. The total group loan is for 59,000 lempiras. With it, they are going to fertilize their coffee crops. In the photo from the left of the back row is Ma Eusebia, then Ledly, Francisco, Pedro and José Teodoro. In the front are José, María, José Inés, José Manuel, Santos and Armando on the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to do maintenance on the coffee farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a house.

loans.name: Consuelo Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socias microempresarias una de ellas Brunilda mujer de 59 años, soltera, su negocio es la venta de tortillas  desde hace 4 años, ella las comercializa en su domicilio. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 6 años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de quintal de maíz, leña, cal, bolsas. Judith mujer de 36 años su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva, Maribel mujer de 30 años su negocio es la venta de ropa y sandalias.
texts.en: The group is made up of three micro-business women. One of them is Brunilda, a 59 year old woman. Her business has been selling tortillas for 4 years. She sells them from her house. She has been a client of the institution for 6 years. She is asking for the loan to buy a quintal of corn, firewood, lime, and bags. Judith is a 36 year old woman and her business is selling new clothes. Maribel is a 30 year old woman and her business is selling clothes and sandals.

loans.use: to buy a quintal of corn, firewood, lime, and bags.

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.ru: Рахмат жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 45 лет. Он женат и имеет четверо детей. У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход в семье, все члены семьи пытаются как-то зарабатывать деньги. Каждый трудится как может. Сам Рахмат работает дехканином. От этой работы он получает хороший доход. Он выращивает в своём небольшом саду виноград. Хотя это сезонный бизнес, но он также приносит Рахмату доход. Основным и стабильным бизнесом Рахмата является животноводство. Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом, а также продаёт полученное от скота молоко. Бизнес животноводства приносит Рахмату хороший и стабильный доход. Поэтому он желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого Рахмат обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Рахмат заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Rahmat is a cheerful 45 year old man. He is married and has four children. They make a very friendly family. They live in a rural area. In order to earn an income for the family, everyone tries to make money somehow, doing what they can. Rahmat himself works on a communal farm, where he earns a good income. He also grows grapes in his own small garden. Although it is a seasonal business, it earns him some income. The primary and most stable business Rahmat has is raising livestock. He transports and sell animals. He wife helps him with the work. She cares for the animals, and also sells milk from them. The livestock raising business earns Rahmat a good stable income. Therefore he wants to expand it. He needs to buy a few more head to raise and then sell. To do this Rahmat came to Arvand to ask for a loan to buy livestock. He hopes that the business will be successful in its expansion and bring more income to meet the family's needs well. Rahmat thanks Arvand ahead of time for the support.

loans.use: purchase livestock

loans.name: Rayito De Sol Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socios microempresarios uno de ellos es Jessenia tiene la edad de 30 años, casada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es hacer recorridos escolares desde la comarca pacayita hasta Diriomito y Catarina, tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad 2 años, el crédito lo está solicitando para darle mantenimiento al microbús, cambio de aceite, llantas, mejor acondicionamiento. Miguel tiene 30 años su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace 1 año, Ligia tiene la edad de 30 años su negocio es la venta de nacatamales y granos básicos desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three members who own small businesses. One of the members is Jessenia, 30. She is married and has two children. She has a business in giving children rides to school from the Pacayita region to Diriomito and Catarina. She has had this business for two years.

She is requesting this loan to perform maintenance on her microbus, including changing the oil and tires, and improving the air conditioner.

Miguel, 30, has had a business in selling clothing and shoes for one year and Ligia, 30, has had a business in selling nacatamales and basic grains for two years.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her microbus, including changing the oil and tires, and improving the air conditioner.

loans.name: Flor Silvestre Group

texts.es: Flor de María es una de los tres socios del grupo ella tiene la edad de 33 años, casada, con tres hijos de 12, 5 y 2 años, su negocio es la compra y venta de muebles desde hace 7 años, su esposo es quien le ayuda a darle el acabado final a los muebles ya que ella  los compra rústicos. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año y medio. Invertirá  nuevamente en la compra de juegos de sillas mecedoras, camas unipersonales, matrimoniales, tocador, comedor, etc. Blanca tiene 36 años su negocio es un taller de mueblería y Larry su negocio es la elaboración y venta de artesanía.
texts.en: Flor de Maria is one of the three members of the group. She is 33 years old and married, with three children, ages 12, 5, and 2. Her business for seven years has been buying and selling furniture. Her husband is the one who helps her give the final finish to the furniture, since she buys it rough. She has been a client of this institution for a year and a half. She will once again invest in the purchase of sets of rocking chairs, single and double beds, dressing tables, dining room sets, etc. Blanca is 36 years old. Her business is a furniture workshop. Larry's business is making and selling handcrafts.

loans.use: to invest once again in the purchase of sets of rocking chairs, single and double beds, dressing tables, dining room sets, etc.

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.en:
Maria is one of the members of the Fuente Para el Desarrollo (Font for Development) 4. They are micro-businesswomen who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, artisan crafts, etc. They are in the city of Samana, a tourist town in development. Their town is still rural but is a great natural escape, and these borrowers use this to sell their products to people visiting their town. Maria is a single woman, working to become a professional and to have a successful business, she is planning to run a Spa.

Maria is very excited to be receiving her third loan from Esperanza International. She has successfully paid off her previous loans and taken steps to grow her business. She started her business almost two years ago. She offers manicure, pedicure, massage and other beautician services. She will invest her new loan in purchasing hair and beauty products as well as other beauty parlor accessories. She will use her earnings to re-invest in the business while she saves for her future and studies. Maria thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy beauty, manicure and pedicure products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, sugar, Maggi-cubes, plastic bags, etc., for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, soap, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana de 53 años de edad, habita en un municipio cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla; ella es madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 15 a 35 años y propietaria de un negocio de elaboración y venta de productos fritos y de arepas asadas. 
Su negocio inició desde hace 2 años, cuando identificó el potencial del mercado de personas que se iban a trabajar sin desayunarse. Ella primero, observó la experiencia de una persona en un barrio vecino y la imitó, para realizar su sueño generador de ingresos. Sus principales productos son los chuzos de carne, pollo y las arepas asadas, además de diversas frituras que se convierten en las delicias de quienes la consumen,.
Diariamente ella se levanta, prepara su masa, la corta, las moldea y las rellena de rica carne  y pollo con verduras y las vende en un local ubicado en su domicilio. Sus ventas las realiza de contado desde los lunes a  domingos y desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la mañana. Sus compras las realiza de contado a mayoristas, que le ofrecen precios competitivos. 
Sus principales clientes los  vecinos de la comunidad donde habita  y espera de ellos poder impactarlos día a día, para ampliar su cobertura actual y finalmente aumentar la calidad de vida de su  familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una vitrina calentadora, para conservar sus alimentos a una temperatura agradable y también insumos como harinas, sal, azúcar, grasas y cárnicos , que harán incrementar su producción , lo cual es el éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en:
Juana is 53 years old and the mother of three children between the ages of 15 and 35. She lives in a municipality near the city of Barranquilla. Juana’s business is making and selling fried foods and arepas asadas [grilled flatbreads made with maize flour and served with cheese or meat]. She started her business two years ago, when she recognized the potential to sell to people who were leaving for work without having eaten breakfast. 

At first, Juana observed the experiences of a woman with a business in a nearby neighborhood. She then followed her example to make her dream way to earn money a reality.  

Juana’s main products are skewers of beef and chicken, arepas asadas and different fried foods, which she says become delicacies for the people who buy them. Every day, Juana gets up and prepares the dough, which she cuts, molds and fills with delicious meat, chicken and vegetables. She makes her sales out of her home in cash, Monday through Sunday, from four until ten in the morning. Juana buys her ingredients in cash from wholesalers who give her competitive prices.

Juana’s primary customers are neighbors who live in her town. She says that she hopes to impress them day after day in order to increase her customer base, which will ultimately improve her family’s quality of life.

Juana is requesting her first loan with Kiva and the field partner to buy a heated display case to keep her food at the right temperature. She will also use it to buy ingredients such as flour, salt, sugar, fats and meat in order to increase her production, which will make this investment a success.

loans.use: to buy a heated display case and ingredients such as flour, salt, sugar, oil, fats and meat.

loans.name: Alimbubu

texts.ru: Алимбубу 58 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Алимбубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Алимбубу занимается животноводством, стартовав 34 года назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Алимбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 2 теленка, 1 жеребенок, 35 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алимбубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Алимбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Alimbubu is 58 years old, married, and raising 4 children with her spouse. Alimbubu has a high school education and provides her family's primary income by eaising animals. She started 34 years ago with a 15,000 som (KGS) purchase of livestock. Thanks to Alimbubu's tireless work, she now owns three dairy cows, a horse, two calves, a foal, and 35 sheep. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). With the goal of further developing her business, Alimbubu came to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a 35,000 som (KGS) loan to expand her livestock herd. She plans to invest the earnings from use of the loan into further increasing her number of animals, and she also plans to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy cow

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es: Eliezer es uno de los cuatro integrantes que forman este grupo solidario tiene la edad de 25 años, soltero, con un hijo menor bajo su responsabilidad, su negocio es la elaboración y  venta de calzado en un tramo del mercado local de Masaya desde hace 4 años, tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año. Solicita el crédito nuevamente para comprar materiales como pega, hilos, brasil, cuero, forro, suelas, hebillas, etc. Fabiola tiene la edad de 32 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos, ropa y calzado, Xiomara tiene la edad de 26 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado y cosméticos, Manfield tiene 24 años se dedica a la venta de fajas y bolsos.
texts.en: Eliezer is one of the four members who make up this group. He is 25 years old and single, with a young son who is his responsibility. His business for four years has been making and selling footwear in a section of the local market in Masaya. He has been a client of this institution for a year. He is applying for the loan once again to purchase materials such as glue, thread, Brazilian leather, leather, linings, soles, buckles, etc. Fabiola is 32 years old, and her business is selling cosmetics, clothing, and footwear. Xiomara is 26; she sells clothing, footwear, and cosmetics. Manfield is 24 and sells belts and bags.

loans.use: to once again buy materials such as glue, thread, Brazilian leather, leather, linings, soles, buckles, etc.

loans.name: Shalom 2 Group

texts.en:
Lucia is the coordinator of the group "Shalom 2," named like this in honor to the biblical word. This group is located in Hato Mayor city, in the eastern part of the country. The group includes five micro-business people who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc. Lucia's family includes herself, her long-term partner, and two children from the six they have.

She is very excited to receive her 12th loan with Esperanza Internacional after having duly repaid her previous loan and taken steps to grow her business. She has had her business for about six years. She started it when she took her first loan. Lucia plans to invest her new loan in her business. She is running a cafeteria, where she sells sandwiches, juice and other snack foods. She will invest this loan to purchase goods for sandwiches, hot dogs, natural juices, fried foods, and other snack foods. She will use her business profits to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase goods for sandwiches, hot dogs, natural juices, and other snack foods.

loans.name: Prosperidad 3 Group

texts.en:
Nury is one of the members of Prosperidad (Prosperity) group 3. Her group is located in the areas surrounding Santiago and is comprised of five entrepreneurs, from one of the poorest communities of this large city, dedicated to running small businesses from their houses and by making walking sales.

Nury is a single mother with two children. She is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Kiva's partner, Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business where she sells motor oil and gasoline. She runs this business in front of her house, in one of the main roads in her community. She also sells fuel bottles. She will use her profits to save and reinvest in her business. 

Nury says that her most difficult challenge is to provide for her children. As she is a single mother, she needs to work hard for all their needs. She enjoys watching television and staying with her children. She dreams of having her own house in the near future, so that she can stop paying rent and to send her children to the university. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, motor oil, and others fuel

loans.name: Blanca Cecilia

texts.es: Blanca de 34 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su grupo familiar, conformado por su esposo y sus dos hijas de 10 y 8 años de edad. Para Blanca y su esposo lo más importante son sus hijas y es por ellas que trabajan duramente para llevar el sustento diario. Blanca trabaja como costurera y gracias a su carisma y buen trabajo ya tiene muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Su deseo es que sus hijas tengan mejores oportunidades a las que ella y su esposo han tenido. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para introducir la energía eléctrica a su vivienda lo cual ayudará a sus hijas en su desarrollo. También desea construir una pila ya que no cuenta con un lugar adecuado para reguardar el agua. El crédito lo usara para instalar la energía eléctrica y para comprar cemento, ladrillo y arena para construir la pila. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así dar a su familia mejores condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en:
Blanca is 34 years old. She lives in her own house with her family which includes her husband and their two daughters. They are are ten and eight years old. For Blanca and her husband, their daughters are the most important. For them, they work hard to give them food daily. Blanca works as a seamstress. Thanks to her charisma and her good work, she has many customers that prefer her more every day.  Her wish is that her daughters will have better opportunities than Blanca and her husband have had. She made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI in order to add electricity to her house which will help her daughters in their development. 
Also, she wants to build a sink since they do not have an adequate place to hold water. This loan will be used to install electrical wiring and to purchase cement, bricks and sand to build a sink. She hopes to count on this support and then she can give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: purchase cement, bricks and sand in order to build a sink and add electrical service

loans.name: Creciendo Para El Futuro 5 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group, "Creciendo Para el Futuro ("Growing for the Future")5". Her group is located in Samana, a lush and rugged peninsula with a new and still undeveloped tourism industry. She is a single mother with 4 children. Juana wants to establish her business by building a local shop on a plot of land next to her house. 

Having repaid her previous loans, and because her business has grown, Juana is excited to be taking her 10th loan with Esperanza. She has had her retail clothing and shoe sales business for around five years. Juana plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying dozens of each product in order to sell them for the Christmas season. She will use the additional profits to save and and to supply some of the needs of her children and for her home. Juana dreams of becoming a professional and having a successful business. This Esperanza associate began with us to access loans for her business. She thanks you all for your support!!

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products (cosmetics, women accessories, etc.)

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine, 40, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Marcelino, a maintenance man and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Josephine operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Josephine dreams that her business will be flourishing and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and products needed in her business

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
This is Belen, 53, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Pablo, a taxi driver and they have children. She and her husband are managing their household as they operate the business. At this time, she is working hard to earn income for their family.

Belen operates an internet café business. Services like this become a need as customer demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who need her services for school requirements. She has customers who need to rent computers for business purposes, like writing a resume or any office documentation; as well as customers who would just love to surf the net and visit any social network.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business.

Belen hopes to be successful in business and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros, 58, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Tranquilino, a driver and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. Both of them are working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Milagros operates a piggery. She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market.  Aside from this she also cooks and sells breakfast meals for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,200 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy feed and additional hogs. 

Milagros dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her family will always be happy and united. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional hogs needed for her business

loans.name: Amor En Cristo Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatro socios emprendedores uno de ellos es Grace mujer de 28 años, acompañada, su negocio es venta de enchiladas y frescos en su domicilio desde hace 4 años. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como tortillas, arroz, aceite, harina, repollo, carne de res, bolsas, leña, para los refrescos  azúcar, leche, cacao, melón, granadilla, naranjas,  bolsas, hielo. Jacqueline tiene 24 años su negocio es la compra y venta de cosechas, Ymarcis tiene 20 años se dedica a la venta de sopa y baho, Elvi tiene 21 años su negocio es la venta de tomate.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four member entrepreneurs. One of them is Grace, a 28 year old partnered woman. For four years, her business has been selling enchiladas and fresh fruit drinks in her house. 

She needs a loan to buy raw materials, such as tortillas, rice, oil, flour, cabbage, beef, bags, firewood, sugar for soft drinks, milk, cocoa, melon, passion fruit, oranges, bags and ice.
