Jacqueline is 24 and her business is buying and selling crops. Ymacis is 20 and earns a living selling soup and baho, a Nicaraguan dish. Elvi is 21 years old and her business is selling tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as tortillas, rice, oil, flour, cabbage, beef, bags, firewood, sugar for soft drinks, milk, cocoa, melon, passion fruit, oranges, bags and ice.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Beatrice from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is widowed and blessed with seven children.  She began her business because she wanted to improve her status of living. In 2009, Beatrice established her general stock business.  She works at the business from 8:00am to 7:00pm seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Beatrice requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her living conditions. In the future, Beatrice plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and pure water.

loans.name: Kulbarchin

texts.ru: Кульбарчын 58 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Кульбарчын - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кульбарчын занимается животноводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кульбарчын, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кульбарчын обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кульбарчын планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Kulbarchin is 58 years old, married, and raising 3 children with her spouse. Kulbarchin has a high school education, and provides the primary source of income for her family by raising animals. She started 8 years ago with a 20,000 som (KGS) purchase of livestock. Thanks to her tireless work, she now owns a dairy cow. She earns a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business Kulbarchin came to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a 110,000 som (KGS) loan to buy cows to increase her herd. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding the number of animals she has, and saving for construction of a new house.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 35 years old, married, and has six children.

Anne works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Anne has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Anne aspires to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 19-year-old Adama from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with two children. In 2007, Adama established her drug-vending business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business twelve hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that moving door to door to sell her drugs is very difficult.

Adama requires a loan in order to buy variety of medical drugs to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Adama plans to own a big pharmacy. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buya  variety of medical drugs to expand her business.

loans.name: Sagipakan

texts.ru: Сагипакан 52 года, замужем, все дети женаты и проживают отдельно от родителей. У Сагипакан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Сагипакан занимается животноводством, стартовав 34 года назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сагипакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сагипакан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Сагипакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство дополнительного помещения для скота.
texts.en: Sagipakan is 52 years old and married. All of her children are married and living apart from their parents. Sagipakan has a high school education, and provides the primary source of income for her family by raising livestock. She started 34 years ago with a 1,000 som (KGS) purchase of animals. Thanks to her tireless work Sagipakan now has two dairy cows, a horse, and ten sheep. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business Sagipakan came to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a 50,000 som (KGS) loan to buy two heifers to increase her head of livestock. She plans to invest the earnings from use of the loan into further expanding her herd, and she also plans to save for construction of an additional shelter for the animals.

loans.use: to buy 2 heifers

loans.name: Fialelei

texts.en:
Fialelei is a 45 years old, married, and has 5 children. 

She would like to start growing taro and banana trees to earn a living. Fialelei has requested a loan to buy rakes,bush-knives, a wheelbarrow, chemicals and a crowbar. 

She has been a member of SPBD for 2 years. Fialelei will spend her profits to pay her children's school fees and provide for her family's needs. 
"

loans.use: to buy rakes, bush-knives, a wheelbarrow, chemicals and a crowbar

loans.name: Valle De Las Americas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por seis miembros uno de ellos es Luis tiene la edad de 34 años, acompañado, su negocio es trabajar en una moto taxi en los alrededores de su comunidad desde hace 7 años. El crédito lo solicita para darle mantenimiento, arreglo de la misma y compra de repuesto. Anabel mujer de 41 años su negocio es la compra y venta de cosechas, Carlota mujer de 41 años su negocio es la venta de gaseosas, vigoron, leche, café, Claudia tiene 21 años su negocio es la venta de nacatamales, tortillas y tamales rellenos, Esperanza tiene 33 años se dedica a la venta de tamales pisques y Camilo hombre de 27 años se dedica a trabajar una moto taxi.
texts.en:
This group is made up of six members, one of whom is Luis. He is 34 years old and partnered. For seven years, his business has been working a moto taxi in the areas around his community. He is asking for a loan to maintain and fix the taxi and buy spare parts.

Anabel, a 41 year old woman, has a business buying and selling crops. Carlota, a 41 year old woman, has a business selling soft drinks, pork rinds, milk and coffee. Claudia is 21 years old, and her business is selling nacatamales (sweet pepper in banana leaves), tortillas and filled tamales. Experanza is 33 and earns her living selling tamales. Camilo, a 27 year old man, makes his living driving a moto taxi.

loans.use: to maintain and fix a moto taxi and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is a widow. She has one adult son. Alla runs her own business.

At the central market Alla sells underwear, socks, and stockings.  She has been in this business for more than five years. Alla is hardworking and patient. She wants to develop her business to receive more income.

Alla is asking for a loan in the amount of 10 000 UAH to buy new goods: warm socks, stockings, and winter hats.

loans.use: to purchase warm socks, stockings, and winter hats

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 54 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposa quien es empleada doméstica. Francisco se dedica a la pesca de manera artesanal desde hace mucho tiempo. De esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar y logra sacar ingresos para los gastos diarios. Su vivienda es muy sencilla y necesita urgentemente el cambio del techo ya que se encuentra deteriorado y cuando llueve se filtra el agua. Además, desea encementar el piso que actualmente es de tierra. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, grava y arena para hacer las mejoras pertinentes. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así comenzar lo antes posible las reparaciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Francisco is 54 years old. He lives in his own home, together with his wife who is a housemaid. Francisco has worked as an artisanal fisherman for a very long time. This is his method of sustaining his household and he can earn enough income for their daily expenses. His home is very simple and it urgently needs a roof replacement because the current roof is deteriorating and when it rains water leaks through it. Moreover, he would like to cement his floor which is currently made of dirt. He is seeking this loan from FUSAI, for these aforementioned tasks, to invest it in the purchase of galvanized sheet metal, wood, cement, gravel and mud to complete the most pertinent tasks. He hopes that he can count on this support and begin the repairs to his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, cement, gravel and mud to repair the roof and to cement the floor of his home.

loans.name: Amor Y Paz Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socias emprendedoras de éxitos una de ellas es Martha mujer de 37 años, casada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es la venta de frutas y leña por fletes  desde hace 16 años se dedica a esta actividad. Requiere el crédito para la compra de frutas como aguacate, mango y leña. Rebeca tiene 24 años su negocio es la venta de leña desde hace 4 años y Yessica tiene 24 años se dedica a la venta de tortillas, verduras y leña.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three successful member entrepreneurs. One of them is Martha, a 37 year old married woman with two children under her care. Her business is selling fruits and firewood for freight. She has earned her living doing this for 16 years. She needs the loan to buy fruits, like avocado and mango, and firewood.

Rebeca is 24 years old and for four years, her business has been selling firewood. Yessica is 24 years old and earns her living selling tortillas, vegetables and firewood.

loans.use: to buy fruits, such as avocado and mango, and firewood.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the materials that she needed in her tailoring business. She has had this business for twenty years now. Her loan also helped in the education of her children. Her income from her business supports their everyday expenses at home. As a widow, she is working hard to provide for her family's everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials like fabric, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leticia hopes to expand her business and have a grocery store. She dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Angelina works hard to support her family.

She has a buying-and-selling livestock business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling bananas. Angelina is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell for her buying-and-selling livestock business.

Angelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and improve her house.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle business.

Angelica successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Angelica's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 63 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Letecia has a butcher shop business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a 30,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell

loans.name: Procesa

texts.en:
Procesa is 57 years old and a widowed mother of one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Procesa has a food vending business in the Philippines. Procesa requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Procesa has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Procesa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Michelle requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Michelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Dorielyn

texts.en:
Dorielyn works hard to support her family. Dorielyn is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Dorielyn requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Dorielyn has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Dorielyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Genelie

texts.en:
Genelie is 47 years old, married, and has two children.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Genelie is borrowing  17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed for the ducks.

Genelie has been raising ducks for 13 years, and also earns additional income from farming and selling vegetables, and selling duck eggs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for the ducks

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear. Fe is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Celaque Group

texts.es:
Glendy, tiene 21 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene un hijo y reside en el municipio de Gracias Lempira. Ella desde pequeña se dedica a la agricultura junto a su padre, pero hace 4 años tiene su propio cultivo de café. esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos donde aporta con los gastos del hogar. Ha solicitado un préstamo de forma grupal, en lo personal solicita 5,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y abonar y limpiar la finca de café, con el objetivo de brindarle buena asistencia a su parcela y crecer como caficultora. Su plan es ayudar a su familia.
El grupo se llama Celaque, y se forma de cuatro integrantes, que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la caficultura. El préstamo grupal que solicitan es por 20,000 Lempiras y lo van a invertir en la compra de fertilizantes, insumos  para el mantenimiento de la finca de café y limpieza de la misma. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta Carmen, sigue María Nicolasa, María Brígida y Glendy a la derecha.
texts.en:
Glendy is 21 years old and lives in a common law marriage with her husband, with whom she has one son.  She lives in the town of Gracias, Lempira.  Since she was young she has made a living in agriculture with her father, but for four years she has had her own coffee crop.  This activity is the source of income that covers the household expenses.  

She has asked for a loan in group form, of which she is personally requesting 5,000 Lempiras in order to buy fertilizer and manure, and to prune the coffee farm. Her goal is to provide better support for the farm and to grow as a coffee grower.  Her plan is to help her family.

The group is called Celaque and is made up of four members who live in the same community and make a living as coffee growers.  The group loan that has been requested is for 20,000 Lempiras and is going to be used to purchase fertilizers and supplies to maintain and prune the coffee farm.  

In the photo the members can be identified as such: on the left is Carmen, then María Nicolasa, María Brígida, and Glendy on the right.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizer in order to maintain the coffee farm.

loans.name: Lian

texts.en:
Lian is 35 years old and married with two children. Both of her children are in school. Lian works very hard to provide for them.

Lian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Lian has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, Lian would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jeremy

texts.en:
Jeremy works hard to support her family. Jeremy is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Jeremy requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Jeremy has been in this business for 9 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Lamdaria

texts.en:
Lamdaria works hard to support her family. Lamdaria is married and has a fish pond operator business in the Philippines.

Lamdaria requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her fish.

Lamdaria has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Lamdaria would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her fish

loans.name: Khas' Group

texts.en: Originally from the Moung Russey district of the Battambang province, Khas is 49 years old and blessed with two children. She works for a living. She engages in rice farming on two hectares of field. Besides this agribusiness, she earns more income via her husband’s business, purchasing coconuts for resale in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has been in this business for 10 years. Khas is not a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan wisely and it has enabled her to upgrade her living conditions at a gradual pace. For this cycle, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops. She does believe that she can gain a higher income than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops

loans.name: Sora

texts.ru: Сора 50-летняя сельская женщина, активно занимающаяся растениеводством в своем районе Шахритус. Она вместе с мужем занимается выращиванием овощей и зерновых культур. Сора сейчас решила еще и заняться животноводческой деятельностью, потому что она считает, что это прибыльный бизнес и к тому же она может вести его параллельно со своей земледельческой деятельностью. Сора будет брать корм для скота в основном со своего земельного участка. Она уже запаслась 400 вязкой высушенной кукурузной травой и 30 вязкой высушенной прессированной посевной травой. То есть у Сора есть все условия для ведения этой деятельности. Она будет держать скот в коровнике, который построен при дворе ее дома. Сора накопила сбережение в размере 500 долларов. По причине того, что ей не хватает еще определенной суммы для закупа бычков, она обратилась за кредитом. Сора планирует закупить 4 голов молодых бычков, откармливать в течение 30-35 дней и после продавать по прибыльной цене на скотном рынке. В этом бизнесе ей будет помогать муж.
texts.en:
Sora is a 50 year old woman from the rural area of Shahrituz, who is working in agriculture.  Together with her husband, she grows vegetables and cereal crops.  Recently, Sora decided to start raising cattle, which, she thinks, is a profitable business that she can carry-on in parallel to her agricultural work.  Sora will collect feed for the cattle from her own plot of land.  Already, she has collected and saved 400 bales of dried corn stalks and 30 bales of dried grasses.  In other words, Sora has all of the tools that she needs to carry out her enterprise.  She will keep cattle in the bard, which was built as an addition to her house.  

Sora has saved 500 dollars, however, this is not enough money to purchase additional calves.  She is asking for a loan to purchase four calves that she will raise for the duration of 30-35 days, after which, she will sell them at a premium price at the market.  Her husband will be helping her with this business.

loans.use: To purchase four calves in order to launch her new business

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
Dario is a 53-year-old man from the town of Dauis, Bohol. He is married and has 10 children. The youngest child is 12. He engages in fishing. He catches and sells fish to help augment the income of their household. He started his business 10 years ago. He is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing nets, hooks and paint to continue his livelihood activity. 

In the future, Dario would like to expand his fishing business and increase business profitability to pay for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing nets, hooks, and paint

loans.name: Julie May

texts.en:
Julie May is a 22-year-old woman from the town of Dauis, Bohol.  She is married and has a 2 year old child. Her husband works as a fisherman to support their family. She engages in selling Avon products like facial cleansers, deodorant, other beauty products  and clothing  apparel in order to help augment the income of their household. Her business started 4 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy more Avon inventory like lotions, talc powder, body spray, and cologne to sell. 

In the future, Julie May would like to expand her business and increase business profitability to secure her child's welfare.

loans.use: to buy more Avon inventory like lotions, talc powder, body spray, and cologne to sell

loans.name: Principe De Paz Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias trabajadoras y luchadoras una de ellas se llama Arleny tiene la edad de 25 años, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada ambulante  desde hace 3 años se dedica a esta actividad económica. Solicita el crédito para la compra de pacas de ropa variada como ropa de cama, pantalones de varón, pantalones de dama, camisas, camisetas, shores, etc. Geysel mujer de 27 años su negocio es la venta de buñuelos y Luisa tiene la edad de 20 años su negocio es la venta de pacas de ropa.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three hard-working, fighting women. One of them is called Arleny. She has been selling used clothing door-to-door for the past three years. She is requesting a loan to buy bales of varied clothing such as bedding, pants, shirts, T-shirts, shorts, etc. 

Geysel is a 27 year old woman who sells donuts. Luisa is 29 and she sells used clothing.

loans.use: to buy bales of a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 51 years old and a widow with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lucy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase coffee, sardines, shampoo, and other groceries to sell.

Lucy has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Lucy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, sardines, shampoo, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes a 61 year old farmer lives in Ndaragwa area of Central Kenya. She has been doing farming for 30 years dealing with dairy cows, poultry and some crops, which she sells in the local market as her source of income. She loves feeding her livestock whenever she is in the farm.  Her challenge is finding the right and ready market for her products.

Agnes chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer good terms on their loan repayment. This loan will help improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a photography business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials like photo paper, ink, etc., for her photography business.

Macaria has been in this business for 22 years. Macaria earns additional income from a buy and sell school supplies business.

Macaria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to buy an additional machine for her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like photo paper, ink, etc.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 51 years old and a widow with two children.

Manuela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling rope in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of rope to sell.

Manuela has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rope business for eight years and earns additional income from a general store.

Manuela aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of rope to sell

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy works hard to support her family. Judy is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Judy requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy food to sell like chicken, hotdogs, meat, etc.

Judy has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Judy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy food to sell like chicken, hotdogs, meat, etc.

loans.name: Chhin's Group

texts.en: Chhin, a married mother blessed with two children too young for schooling, is 34 years old and a villager from the Battambang province. For the sake of her family, she grows paddy rice on two hectares of farmland and works for others to supplement her income. This business has given her about 40,000 KHR per day. Chhin is a quite new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now in a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy potash as well as insecticide for her crops. She hopes that she can gain three times more yield than before so that she can make more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy potash as well as insecticide for her crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover his school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her daughter’s school fees

loans.name: Sento

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 27-year-old Sento from Waterloo eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 3 children. She started a business to take care of her family. 

Sento runs a food stand business at home.  She sells rice, pure water, and cooking seasonings.  She has been running this business since 2012. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Sento says that the main challenge to her business is the price of transportation and insufficient finance to expand her business.

Sento has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, pure water, and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, pure water, and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Muhabatsho

texts.ru: Этого мужчину зовут Мухабатшо. Ему 66 лет. Свои 34 года жизни он провел на дороге. Мухабатшо таксист. У него имеется большой опыт работы и немало постоянных клиентов. Предоставления услуги такси для семьи Мухабатшо было единственным источником дохода. От своих услуг он вырастил и поставил на ноги своих детей. На сегодняшний день его дети уже взрослые и самостоятельные. Но Мухабатшо не собирается бросать свою работу, он считает, что он еще не старый и в состоянии работать, и приносить доход. Его машина стала для него лучшим другом.  Он работал таксистом в течение 34 лет и хочет работать еще столько же. Мухабатшо нуждается в кредите, чтобы отремонтировать свою машину. На данный момент его машина сломалось и не пригодна для работы. Мухабатшо надеется купить автозапчасти и сделать ремонт. Мухабатшо ждет Вашей помощи!
texts.en:
Muhabatsho is 66 years old.  His recent 34 years of life, he had spent on the road.  Muhabatsho is a taxi driver.  He has a lot of experience in this line of work and a number of permanent clients.  This work provided Muhabatsho's family with their sole source of income.  Working as a taxi drive, he was able to raise his children to be independent adults.  However, Muhabatsho is not about to leave his job; he considers himself to be young enough to continue to bring in some income.  

His car had become his best friend.  He has, already, been a taxi driver for 34 years and he hopes to spend another 34 years doing the same.  Muhabatsho is in need of a loan to repair his car.  Currently, it is broken and cannot be used for work.  Muhabatsho is hoping to purchase car parts for it and to do the necessary repairs.  Muhabatsho is waiting for your help!

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Amor Y Paz Group

texts.es: Este grupo lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Doris mujer de 40 años, casada, su negocio es venta de  leña y compra de piezas de vehículos desarmados desde hace 7 años. El crédito lo requiere  para la compra de fletes de leña y compra de piezas de vehículo. Mercedes mujer de 27 años su negocio es la venta de leña y Angela mujer de 58 años su negocio es la venta de zapatos y venta de ropa.
texts.en: This group is composed of three working women. One of them is Doris, a 40 year old married woman. Her 7 year old businesses are selling firewood and purchasing pieces of disassembled cars. She needs this loan to purchase bundles of firewood and car parts. Another woman, Mercedes, is 27 years old and her business is selling firewood. Angela, a 58 year old woman has a business selling shoes and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood and to purchase car parts.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma, age 45, is from Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three children. PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her pig-raising business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good pigs, in order to sell them continuously. 

Guillerma is now trying to expand her pig business and has also decided to venture into a little restaurant. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of 50,000 PHP [Philippines pesos]. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants her business to be well-known and to build a good business management for her loyal customers. With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her carenderia (small restaurant).

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en:
Yuliana is a 39-year-old woman who is married to Bernardus, a 46-year-old man. They have been blessed with two children: Irma, 16, in the first grade of senior high school; and Doni, 11, in the sixth grade of elementary school. 

Yuliana is a dried areca and tobacco trader in the local market. She has been running this business for seven years. She initiated the business by purchasing two tons of dried arecas with IDR 50,000 of her own capital. From the business she was able to earn IDR 20,000 per sack. 

At the moment, Yuliana needs additional money to buy two tons of dried arecas. She thus has applied to TLM for an individual loan of IDR 10,000,000.

loans.use: to buy two tons of dried arecas

loans.name: Julie Pearl

texts.en: Due to lack of job opportunities, Julie Pearl decided to start buying and selling beauty products within her local community. She is 27 years old and single. Julie Pearl aims to improve her business and make it a profitable source of income in order to help her parents generate income for a living. She plans to acquire more stock of beauty products to sell, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more stock of soap, perfumes, face powder, lotion, coffee and dishwashing liquid to sell. She believes that her requested loan will enable her to obtain her goal in life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soap, perfumes, face powder, lotion, coffee and dishwashing liquid to sell

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 500 nuevos soles para comprar una vaca lechera y de esta manera vender la leche en el mercado de la zona, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Graciela is 38 years old and lives with her husband and children in the district of Zaña, whose people make a living from agriculture and commerce. She is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Perú.

Together with her husband she makes a living by raising and selling cattle. She has asked for a loan of 3,500 Peruvian nuevos soles to buy a milk cow. In this way she will sell the milk in the market in the area, generating greater earnings for her family.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Nonieta

texts.en:
Nonieta is 59 years old, married and has five children. 

Nonieta is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Nonieta requested a 10,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

Nonieta has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nonieta would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 42 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosalie is borrowing 11,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalie has been pig fattening for 20 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz is 35 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Maria Luz works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Luz runs a buy-and-sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Maria Luz has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Maria Luz would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support her family. Rosita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Rosita requested a 20,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her business.

Rosita has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Rosita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane  works hard to support her family. Mary Jane is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Mary Jane requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Mary Jane has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Melba works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending. Melba is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Melba has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Yung's Group

texts.en: Yung is a widowed mother of one kid residing in Ponhea Krek’s district of Kampong Cham province. She earns a living by managing her one hectare rice farm and her two hectares cassava farm. She has been involved in her current business for several years and she is able to earn about 25,000 KHR per day. Now, Yung leads a group of two to get the first time loan with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). For this loan, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice paddy. She does believe that she can gain double income from a good yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice paddy.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Zoila America

texts.es: Zoila de 57 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hija. Ella tiene 15 años de haber establecido una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia la cual es una de sus principales fuetes de ingreso. Su esposo es albañil y le ayuda con la economía del hogar. Para Zoila lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que trabaja duramente para darles mejores condiciones de vida. Su deseo es ver crecer su tienda y poder convertirse en una de las tiendas líderes de la localidad. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mercadería (azúcar, frijoles, arroz, golosinas, bebidas, etc.) para cubrir la demanda existente y atraer a nuevos clientes que le permitan aumentar las ventas y con ello sus ingresos.
texts.en: Zoila is 57 years old. She lives in her own home together with her husband and her daughter. 15 years ago Zoila established a small store in her home which is one of her primary sources of income. Her husband is a stonemason and he helps her with their household expenses. Her family is the most important thing to Zoila and it is why she works hard to give them better living conditions.  Her wish is see her store grow and become one of the leading stores in her area. She is seeking this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of merchandise (sugar, beans, rice, candies, drinks, etc.) to cover her existing demand and to attract new customers who will increase her sales and her earnings.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, rice, candies, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Nely Concepcion

texts.es: Nely de 24 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su grupo familiar. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 4 años. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y de esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar. Desea invertir en su negocio de tortillería para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de maíz que es el principal insumo para la elaboración de las tortillas. Su objetivo es hacer crecer su negocio y poder percibir mayores ingresos con la venta y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Nely, 24, lives with her family in humble conditions. She has been making and selling tortillas for 4 years. This business is her main source of income and how she sustains her home. She wants to invest in her tortilla business, and so she asked FUSAI to invest in the purchase of corn, which is the main ingredient for making her tortillas. Her goal is to grow her business and be able to make more income with their sales and thus improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Cristobal Rafael

texts.es: Cristóbal  de 27 años de edad es un joven emprendedor y muy trabajador quien desde muy pequeño se gana la vida  honradamente. Él se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y de esta forma se gana la vida para llevar el sustento a su querida compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de uno y seis años de edad. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de maíz al por mayor con el fin de poder satisfacer las necesidades de todos sus clientes que cada día lo prefieren. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así poder aumentar sus ventas las cuales le permitan mayores ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Cristóbal, 27, is a young and hardworking entrepreneur who has earned his way from a very young age. He buys and sells corn, which is his main source of income and the way he supports his beloved wife and two children, ages 6 and 1.

He asks FUSAI for a loan to buy corn in bulk so that he can meet his customer's daily demands. He hopes to have this support and be able to increase his sales which will give him more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Angelito Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socios exitosos uno de ellos es María de Jesús mujer de 45  años, acompañada, su negocio es la venta de frutas y perecederos  en la terminal de buses del mercado Israel, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de sacos de tomate, cebolla, chiltoma, papa, banano. María Luisa mujer de 25 años su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y Julio tiene la edad de 20 años su negocio es la venta de verduras.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three successful members, one of whom is Maria de Jesus. She is 45, married, and works selling fruits and perishables in the bus terminal in the Israel market. This loan will be used to buy sacks of tomato, onion, sweet pepper, potato and banana.

Maria Luisa, 24, sells new clothing, and Julio, 30, sells vegetables.

loans.use: to buy sacks of tomato, onion, sweet pepper, potato and banana.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is married with two children. Milagros is 46 years old and lives in Barangay Catagan, Tangub City.

Milagros sells caviar to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] to to buy additional ingredients for her business.

Milagros is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Milagros hope to improve her living conditions and provide for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her caviar business.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en: Florenda is 53-years-old.  She is married and has seven children. Two of her siblings are already working. She lives in Mitimos, Rizal, Zamboanga Del Norte. Florenda is engaged in the livestock selling business, selling chickens, pigs, cattle, etc. She has been in this business for five years and earns a monthly income of 3,500 PHP. She requested a new loan to purchase various material for her house renovation, especially her kitchen. Florenda has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2005.  She is very thankful for the opportunity given by Paglaum together with its partners.

loans.use: to purchase various materials for her house renovation, especially her kitchen.

loans.name: Jose Teodolfo

texts.es:
Teodolfo tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de San Felipe, su población se dedica al cultivo de limas destacando entre los frutales, café comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicios de construcción, desempeñándose como maestro de obra, es muy conocido en la zona por la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para comprar madera como herramienta de trabajo en las construcciones y de esta manera seguir generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Teodolfo, 40, lives with his wife in the district of San Felipe, two hours from the city of Jaén in the northern mountains of Peru, where the people work growing limes, coffee, and raising cattle.

Teodolfo works in construction as a foreman. He is well known in the area for the work that he does. He has asked for a loan of 2000 new soles to buy wood as a tool for his construction work, so that he can generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy wood, as material for his construction work.

loans.name: Ruby Jane

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Ruby Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Ruby Jane is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like paint, wood, bamboo and other related items for her fishing business.

Ruby Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like paint, wood, bamboo and related items

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Nena has been in this business for 25 years. Nena earns more income from buying and selling salt.

Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling baked products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, flour, eggs and related goods for her baked products business.

Nenita has been in this business for 23 years. Nenita earns additional income from rice farming.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, flour, eggs and related goods.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad. Junto a su esposo mantienen la economía de su hogar y tratan de dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida. María se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace mucho tiempo. Gracias a su carisma y amabilidad ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes quienes cada día la prefieren más y muchas veces no logra cubrir la demanda. En vista de lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de  maíz y unos depósitos para guardarlo ya que es la temporada donde los productores ponen a la venta la cosecha por lo que se encuentra más barato.
texts.en: Maria lives in her own home with her partner and their two children, ages 12 and 8. She and her husband work to support their home financially and try to give their children better living conditions. Maria has been making and selling tortillas for a long time. Thanks to her charisma and friendliness, she has gained the confidence of many customers who prefer her more and more each day, and often she cannot meet the demand. Due to that, she asks FUSAI for a loan to buy corn and some tanks to store it, since this is the season when producers put their harvest on sale for lower prices.

loans.use: to buy corn and tanks to store the corn.

loans.name: Nur-In

texts.en:
Nur-In is a 40-year-old woman from the town of Dauis, Bohol. She is married with 10 children, with ages ranging from one year to twenty years old. Her husband worked as a fisherman to support their family. 

Nur-In engages in food vending. She sells puto (rice cake) and banana brittle to help augment the income of their household. Her business started almost a year ago. She is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, bananas and a food keeper. This will help her to increase output, maintain her capital and also set aside some of the profits for emergency use. 

In the future, Nur-In would like to expand her food vending business and increase the business' profitability for the benefit of her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, bananas and a food keeper

loans.name: Doris Cecilia

texts.es: Doris de 25 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad. Para ella y su compañero de vida lo más importante es su hijo y es por él que trabajan y se esfuerzan por aprovechar las oportunidades que la vida les da. Doris se gana la vida gracias a una pequeña Pupusería (lugar donde hacen pupusas, comida típica hechas de arroz o maíz rellenas de carne, frijol, queso y otros ingredientes) que ha logrado establecer en su hogar de residencia el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Con el fin de abarcar una mayor clientela con su negocio ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de insumos tales como maíz,arroz, queso y frijoles para hacer las deliciosas pupusas que cada día le demandan más. De esta forma espera poder aumentar sus ganancias y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doris, 25, lives in very humble conditions with her husband and her 5-year-old son.  For her and her husband, the most important thing is their son and it is for him that they work and push themselves to take advantage of the opportunities that life gives them.  

Doris earns a living in a small Pupusería (the place where they make papusas, a traditional food made of rice or corn and stuffed with meat, beans, cheese, and other ingredients) that she has succeeded to establish in her home.  This is her main source of income.  

In order to attract a greater clientele with her business, she decided to ask FUSAI for a loan to buy ingredients like corn, rice, cheese, and beans in order to make the delicious papusas that are demanded more every day.  This way, she hopes to increase her earnings and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, cheese, and beans.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en: Clementina is a 35 year old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be strong willed person. She operates a farm where she grows crops and also keeps animals. She describes her family challenge to be poor supply of water. She will use the Kes 8700 loan to buy a 1000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have enough water storage capacity. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a 1000 litre water tank

loans.name: Naguin

texts.es:
Naguin tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, yuca, maíz , comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, Naguin ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de arroz, leche, menestras y de esta manera incrementar su bodeguita y asi generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Naguin, 49, lives with his son in the district of Oyotún, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Perú. The people there grow rice, yucca, and corn, raise cattle, and work in commerce.

He sells groceries out of a store in his home. He has asked for a loan of 1000 new soles to buy rice, milk and beans so that he can increase his store's stock and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy groceries like milk, beans and rice to stock his small store.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 40 years old, married and a resident of Binuangan, Oroquieta City, Mindanao, Philippines. Starting with capitalization of 2,500 PHP, she engaged in a buying and selling business and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in good standing and has taken out several loans. 

Now she is applying for 14,900 PHP to restock inventory for her buying and selling business. In the future, she wants to own a space near the public market where she could display her stock with convenience. She will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her buying and selling business

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 43 years old, a resident of Burgos Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines, and a widower with kids. In order to survive, with a little amount of money she has saved, she engaged in a buy and sell business and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in good standing and has taken out several loans. 

Now, Aurora is applying for 14,900PHP to restock inventories for her buy and sell business.  In the future, she wants to own a space near public market someday where she could display her stocks with convenience, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to restock inventories for her buy and sell business

loans.name: Rosienel

texts.en:
Rosiniel is 37 years old, married and resident of Burgos, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines.  From her desire to help her husband in raising their family, she engaged in a buy and sell business to earn additional income for her family. Luckily, she was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She attended various seminars and other activities conducted by Paglaum MPC. Rosiniel has been active and became a member in good standing, has taken out several loans. 

Now she is applying for 14,900PHP to restock inventories for her buy and sell business.  In the future, she wants to own a space near public market someday where she could display her stocks with convenience, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to restock inventories for her buy and sell business

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a 27 year old married man. He has one child who is 10 years old. He describes himself to be humble and disciplined. He operates a farm where he grows crops. He describes his family challenge to be poor supply of water. He will use the Kes 8700 loan to buy a 1000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will have sufficient water to use during the dry seasons. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 80,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a 1000 litre water tank

loans.name: Baby Kitt

texts.en:
Baby Kitt is 38 years old and married with seven children, six of whom in school, Baby Kitt works very hard to provide for them.

Baby Kitt runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sugar, rice, soap, etc. to sell.

Baby Kitt has been in this business for 2 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sugar, rice, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita works hard to support her family. Conchita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soap, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Conchita has been in this business for 8 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like soap, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Corazon works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Corazon is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Era

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Era works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Era is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Era has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is 49 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Sherly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like can goods, egg, noodles, milk, etc.

Sherly has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Sherly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like can goods, egg, noodles, milk, etc

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Meet Luke a farmer living in Ndaragwa area in Central Kenya. He has done farming for 2 years selling milk, eggs, and crops. He loves farming and he focuses mostly on dairy farming, but his major challenge is controlling animal diseases.

Luke said that he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer training to their farmers before giving them loans. During the training he learnt that as a small scale farmer, he has to develop a lifestyle of saving. This loan will enable him purchase a dairy cow which will bring in more profit and thus improve his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Delmas

texts.en: Delmas is a 31 year old married man. He has 2 children with ages 4 years and 6 years. He describes himself to be focused and determined. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers from one place to another to earn a living. He describes his family challenge to be poor supply of water. He will use the Kes 8700 loan to buy a 1000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will have clean water storage capacity. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a 1000 litre water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy underwear, skirts, blouses, pants, bed sheets, etc.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a 47 year old woman from the town of Dauis, Bohol. She is married with 5 children ages 26 to 10 year old. Her husband worked as a fisherman to support their family. She engages in dress making services to help augment the income of their household. She makes dresses and caters services like dress adjustment. Her business started more than 5 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy cloth and other materials like thread, sewing needles and maintenance for the sewing machine. 

In the future, Isabel would like to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy cloth and other materials like thread, sewing needles and maintenance for the sewing machine

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a 26 year old married woman. She has 2 children with ages 4 years and 6 years. She describes herself as a God fearing person. She operates a farm where she grows crops and keeps animals. She describes her biggest family challenge to be poor water storage facilities. She will use the Kes 8700 loan to buy a 1000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have clean water to use. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a 1000 litre water tank

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is a 55 year old married woman. She has 2 children with ages 15 years and 20 years. She describes herself to be God fearing person. She operates a farm where she grows crops and keeps animals. She describes her family challenge to be poor water supply. She will use the Kes 8700 loan to buy a 1000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have clean water to use. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a 1000 litre water tank

loans.name: Adama     F

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Adama from Waterloo Western 2 rural area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children.  In 2001, Adama established her wax print cotton business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support her home. She works at the business 12 hours per day 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Adama requires a loan in order to buy more clothing materials to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future Adama plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 57 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Leonila is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other supplies.

Leonila has been farming rice for 17 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other supplies

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 54 years old and has five children. Luz is married and has one child who is in school.

Luz is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Luz requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Luz has been farming rice for 30 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lyngie

texts.en:
Lyngie is 33 years old and married with two children.

Lyngie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, softdrinks, etc. to sell.

Lyngie has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lyngie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, softdrinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 57 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Mercy is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to pays for the cultivation of land.

Mercy has been farming sugarcane for 30 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pays for the cultivation of land

loans.name: Ma. Milagrosa

texts.en:
Ma. Milagrosa is 38 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ma. Milagrosa is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Milagrosa has been farming sugarcane for 8 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Leam's Group

texts.en:
Leam is aged 34 years old and married. She lives with her husband and four children in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer of 2 hectare of farmland. She has been in this business for 10 years and she also raises pigs to earn additional income for her family. The current business earns her family about 40,000KHR per day to feed the family but she manages to save about 15,000KHR each day.
This is the first loan for Leam with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to ask for a loan, as the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and earns more income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Nozimjon

texts.ru: Этому молодому талантливому человеку 20 лет. Его зовут Нозимчон. Он родом из городка Вахдат. Нозимчон не получил высшее образование из-за финансового положения своей семьи и после окончания школы он остался в родном городе и устроился на работу, чтобы обеспечить свою большую семью. Нозимчон взял в аренду будку и продает там сим-карты, панели, зарядные устройства и разные другие запчасти для телефонов. Нозимчон не оставил свою мечту. Он очень давно хотел быть оператором. Теперь он у него появился шанс осуществить свою мечту. Нозимчон хочет купить видео камеру и начать предоставлять услуги оператора. Он будет снимать на камеру свадьбы, торжества, национальные праздники и другие разные мероприятия. В Таджикистане большую часть мероприятий и праздников проводят на выходные. Поэтому Нозимчон будет работать в субботу и в воскресение. По будням он будет редактировать свои видео и одновременно продавать сим-карты. Работа оператора на мероприятиях для Нозимчона не только давняя мечта, но и оно станет прибыльным занятием. К сожалению, чтобы купить видеокамеру у Нозимчона не хватает средств. Профессиональная камера стоит дорого и для ее приобретения нужны не малые деньги, поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Нозимчон на сумму он кредита купит видеокамеру и осуществит свою мечту.
texts.en:
Nozimjon, age 20, is a talented young man from the city of Vahdat.  Because of his family's economic circumstances, he was unable to get a higher education. Instead, he stayed in his hometown after graduation and started to work in order to take care of his large family.

Nozimjon has rented a booth where he currently sells SIM cards, phone panels, chargers as well as other phone replacement components.  However, he has never abandoned his dream of becoming a camera operator one day.  He now has the opportunity to make his dream come true.  He wants to buy a camcorder and start offering video services.  He plans to make videos at weddings, ceremonies, national holidays and various other events.

In Tajikistan, most celebrations and festivities are held on weekends.  Therefore, Nozimjon intends to work on Saturdays and Sundays.  On week days, he plans to edit his video recordings and continue to sell SIM cards.  Working as a cameraman and filming various events is not only Nozimjon's old dream, but it should also be a profitable activity.

Unfortunately, Nozimjon doesn't have enough money to buy a camcorder.  A professional video camera is expensive and purchasing one costs a lot of money, which is the reason why he is taking a loan.  He will use his loan to buy a camcorder and make his dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase a camcorder.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a 53-year-old woman from the town of Dauis, Bohol. She is married with 7 children. Her youngest child is 20 years old. 

Rufina's husband works as a carpenter and a fisherman to support their family, and she engages in a fish vending business. She sells fresh fish to help augment the income of their household. Rufina's business started more than 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy nylon, hooks and additional capital for her fish vending business.

In the future, Rufina hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy nylon, hooks and additional capital for her fish vending business

loans.name: Nuevo Fruto Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Hellen mujer de 33 años, casada, su negocio es la venta de ropa ambulante en su comunidad y alrededores  desde hace 4 años, Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 8 meses. Está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mercadería como pantalones, blusas, camisas, camisetas, shores, perfumes. Arli mujer de 38 años su negocio es la venta de comida y Miriam mujer de 45 años su negocio es belleza y estilismo.
texts.en: The group is made up of three enterprising members.  One of the members is Hellen, a 33-year-old married woman.  She has worked as a street vendor selling clothes in her community and the surrounding area for four years.  She has been a client of the institution for eight months.  Hellen requests another loan to buy merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, shorts, and perfumes.  Arli is a 38-year-old woman who sells food, and Miriam is a 45-year-old woman who is a hair stylist and beautician.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, shorts, and perfumes

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir is 50 years of age. He is a married person. He is also an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  Tahir is a Fuzulu refugee. 

He has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 18 years. He is very hardworking and passionate about his work. He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers and to plant fruit trees with his wife. He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits, in order to support his family. Tahir’s income from this business is 130 AZN [Azerbaijani New Manat]. 

In order to improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. He believes that, in the near future, his sons will help him to grow the business. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and fun, he wants the business to continue and prosper. He has applied to Aqroinvest for a loan of 1,900 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of buying new fertilizer and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to obtain more revenue in the coming winter, which will help him to cover his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 40 years old and married with eight children. Seven of her children are in school.

Nora is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. Nora requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional seeds and other farm supplies.

Nora has been farming vegetables for eight years now, and has borrowed five times previously from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
"Hardworking and industrious mother" best describes Rizalina. She is 50 years old and residing in Labo, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. Rizalina is a widow with four kids. To sustain their daily needs in their family, Rizalina started a business: a food stand or mini eatery. She has been in the business more than two years now. 

Rizalina wants to expand her food stand or mini eatery. She wants to gain more profit and to have enough to sustain her family, especially for her children, so she would be able to send her son to college. In order for Rizalina to make her wish possible, she needs 14,900 PHP [Philippines pesos] additional capital and will use the money to expand her business. She intends to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things that are needed in the food stand. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her children.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her mini eatery.

loans.name: Nela

texts.en:
This 48-year-old woman named Nela is married. She lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City, Mindanao, Philippines. Her husband is a farmer who plants rice and corn for a living. In order to help her husband, Nena engaged in gardening activities like planting vegetables, root crops, and other varieties of agricultural commodities to earn extra income to sustain their family.

In need of additional working capital, Nena decided to join Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested 10,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] for buying farm and garden fertilizer and paying labor costs for cultivating their land.

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the Cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Nena is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to own a tricycle someday to use for transporting their products in neighboring towns. Nela hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to purchase garden and farm fertilizer and pay labor costs for land cultivation.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with four children. Helen is 40 years old and lives in Maikay, Tudela, Philippines.

Helen is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers and other chemicals used for gardening.

Helen has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Helen hopes to put up other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other chemicals used for gardening

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be social. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes, utensils and basins. She describes her family challenge to be the shortage of water. She will use the KES 11,100 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that, in the future, she will purchase a bigger tank. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 10,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Lon's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Moung Russey district, where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Lon is a 56-year-old father. Rice farming is the main source of family’s income; he and his wife have been in that business for 30 years. His wife supplements the income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns them about 30,000 KHR [Cambodian riels] per day to meet the family’s needs.
  
This is the fourth microloan for Lon with Kiva’s partner, and he completely paid back the past loans. Lon has successfully used the loan to improve his standard of living. Now leading his group of three to apply for a loan, Lon will use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to have another source of family income so as to increase his income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farmland.

loans.name: Machimbo Group

texts.en:
Kaeni, who is in his mid 20s, is single.  He has been running a barber shop business for three years now. He works from 8.00 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Kaeni's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy a TV set, radio and two new chairs, all for salon use.  He is doing great with his salon.  Since he started getting loans from Tujijenge, he has been able to get the salon up to date and is getting more and more customers.  He is happy with the loan.  He has paid back all his previous loans successfully.  He used the profit to buy a sofa set, fridge, radio and to cover household expenses.
